44007038	This is the man who was in the congregation in the wilderness with the angel who spoke to him at Mount Sinai , and with our ancestors , and he received living oracles to give to you .
44007039	Our ancestors were unwilling to obey him , but pushed him aside and turned back to Egypt in their hearts ,
44007040	saying to Aaron , ‘ Make us gods who will go in front of us , for this Moses , who led us out of the land of Egypt – we do not know what has happened to him ! ’
44007041	At that time they made an idol in the form of a calf , brought a sacrifice to the idol , and began rejoicing in the works of their hands .
44007042	But God turned away from them and gave them over to worship the host of heaven , as it is written in the book of the prophets : ‘ It was not to me that you offered slain animals and sacrifices forty years in the wilderness , was it , house of Israel ?
44007043	But you took along the tabernacle of Moloch and the star of the god Rephan , the images you made to worship , but I will deport you beyond Babylon . ’
44007044	Our ancestors had the tabernacle of testimony in the wilderness , just as God who spoke to Moses ordered him to make it according to the design he had seen .
44007045	Our ancestors received possession of it and brought it in with Joshua when they dispossessed the nations that God drove out before our ancestors , until the time of David .
44007046	He found favor with God and asked that he could find a dwelling place for the house of Jacob .
44007047	But Solomon built a house for him .
44007048	Yet the Most High does not live in houses made by human hands , as the prophet says ,
44007049	‘ Heaven is my throne , and earth is the footstool for my feet . What kind of house will you build for me , says the Lord , or what is my resting place ?
44007050	Did my hand not make all these things ? ’
44007051	“ You stubborn people , with uncircumcised hearts and ears ! You are always resisting the Holy Spirit , like your ancestors did !
44007052	Which of the prophets did your ancestors not persecute ? They killed those who foretold long ago the coming of the Righteous One , whose betrayers and murderers you have now become !
44007053	You received the law by decrees given by angels , but you did not obey it . ”
44007054	When they heard these things , they became furious and ground their teeth at him .
44007055	But Stephen , full of the Holy Spirit , looked intently toward heaven and saw the glory of God , and Jesus standing at the right hand of God .
44007056	“ Look ! ” he said . “ I see the heavens opened , and the Son of Man standing at the right hand of God ! ”
44007057	But they covered their ears , shouting out with a loud voice , and rushed at him with one intent .
44007058	When they had driven him out of the city , they began to stone him , and the witnesses laid their cloaks at the feet of a young man named Saul .
44007059	They continued to stone Stephen while he prayed , “ Lord Jesus , receive my spirit ! ”
44007060	Then he fell to his knees and cried out with a loud voice , “ Lord , do not hold this sin against them ! ” When he had said this , he died .
44008001	And Saul agreed completely with killing him . Now on that day a great persecution began against the church in Jerusalem , and all except the apostles were forced to scatter throughout the regions of Judea and Samaria .
44008002	Some devout men buried Stephen and made loud lamentation over him .
44008003	But Saul was trying to destroy the church ; entering one house after another , he dragged off both men and women and put them in prison .
44008004	Now those who had been forced to scatter went around proclaiming the good news of the word .
44008005	Philip went down to the main city of Samaria and began proclaiming the Christ to them .
44008006	The crowds were paying attention with one mind to what Philip said , as they heard and saw the miraculous signs he was performing .
44008007	For unclean spirits , crying with loud shrieks , were coming out of many who were possessed , and many paralyzed and lame people were healed .
44008008	So there was great joy in that city .
44008009	Now in that city was a man named Simon , who had been practicing magic and amazing the people of Samaria , claiming to be someone great .
44008010	All the people , from the least to the greatest , paid close attention to him , saying , “ This man is the power of God that is called ‘ Great . ’ ”
44008011	And they paid close attention to him because he had amazed them for a long time with his magic .
44008012	But when they believed Philip as he was proclaiming the good news about the kingdom of God and the name of Jesus Christ , they began to be baptized , both men and women .
44008013	Even Simon himself believed , and after he was baptized , he stayed close to Philip constantly , and when he saw the signs and great miracles that were occurring , he was amazed .
44008014	Now when the apostles in Jerusalem heard that Samaria had accepted the word of God , they sent Peter and John to them .
44008015	These two went down and prayed for them so that they would receive the Holy Spirit .
44008016	( For the Spirit had not yet come upon any of them , but they had only been baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus . )
44008017	Then Peter and John placed their hands on the Samaritans , and they received the Holy Spirit .
44008018	Now Simon , when he saw that the Spirit was given through the laying on of the apostles’ hands , offered them money ,
44008019	saying , “ Give me this power too , so that everyone I place my hands on may receive the Holy Spirit . ”
44008020	But Peter said to him , “ May your silver perish with you , because you thought you could acquire God’s gift with money !
44008021	You have no share or part in this matter because your heart is not right before God !
44008022	Therefore repent of this wickedness of yours , and pray to the Lord that he may perhaps forgive you for the intent of your heart .
44008023	For I see that you are bitterly envious and in bondage to sin . ”
44008024	But Simon replied , “ You pray to the Lord for me so that nothing of what you have said may happen to me . ”
44008025	So after Peter and John had solemnly testified and spoken the word of the Lord , they started back to Jerusalem , proclaiming the good news to many Samaritan villages as they went .
44008026	Then an angel of the Lord said to Philip , “ Get up and go south on the road that goes down from Jerusalem to Gaza . ” ( This is a desert road . )
44008027	So he got up and went . There he met an Ethiopian eunuch , a court official of Candace , queen of the Ethiopians , who was in charge of all her treasury . He had come to Jerusalem to worship ,
44008028	and was returning home , sitting in his chariot , reading the prophet Isaiah .
44008029	Then the Spirit said to Philip , “ Go over and join this chariot . ”
44008030	So Philip ran up to it and heard the man reading Isaiah the prophet . He asked him , “ Do you understand what you’re reading ? ”
44008031	The man replied , “ How in the world can I , unless someone guides me ? ” So he invited Philip to come up and sit with him .
44008032	Now the passage of scripture the man was reading was this : “ He was led like a sheep to slaughter , and like a lamb before its shearer is silent , so he did not open his mouth .
44008033	In humiliation justice was taken from him . Who can describe his posterity ? For his life was taken away from the earth . ”
44008034	Then the eunuch said to Philip , “ Please tell me , who is the prophet saying this about – himself or someone else ? ”
44008035	So Philip started speaking , and beginning with this scripture proclaimed the good news about Jesus to him .
44008036	Now as they were going along the road , they came to some water , and the eunuch said , “ Look , there is water ! What is to stop me from being baptized ? ”
44008038	So he ordered the chariot to stop , and both Philip and the eunuch went down into the water , and Philip baptized him .
44008039	Now when they came up out of the water , the Spirit of the Lord snatched Philip away , and the eunuch did not see him any more , but went on his way rejoicing .
44008040	Philip , however , found himself at Azotus , and as he passed through the area , he proclaimed the good news to all the towns until he came to Caesarea .
44009001	Meanwhile Saul , still breathing out threats to murder the Lord’s disciples , went to the high priest
44009002	and requested letters from him to the synagogues in Damascus , so that if he found any who belonged to the Way , either men or women , he could bring them as prisoners to Jerusalem .
44009003	As he was going along , approaching Damascus , suddenly a light from heaven flashed around him .
44009004	He fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to him , “ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? ”
44009005	So he said , “ Who are you , Lord ? ” He replied , “ I am Jesus whom you are persecuting !
44009006	But stand up and enter the city and you will be told what you must do . ”
44009007	( Now the men who were traveling with him stood there speechless , because they heard the voice but saw no one . )
44009008	So Saul got up from the ground , but although his eyes were open , he could see nothing . Leading him by the hand , his companions brought him into Damascus .
44009009	For three days he could not see , and he neither ate nor drank anything .
44009010	Now there was a disciple in Damascus named Ananias . The Lord said to him in a vision , “ Ananias , ” and he replied , “ Here I am , Lord . ”
44009011	Then the Lord told him , “ Get up and go to the street called ‘ Straight , ’ and at Judas’ house look for a man from Tarsus named Saul . For he is praying ,
44009012	and he has seen in a vision a man named Ananias come in and place his hands on him so that he may see again . ”
44009013	But Ananias replied , “ Lord , I have heard from many people about this man , how much harm he has done to your saints in Jerusalem ,
44009014	and here he has authority from the chief priests to imprison all who call on your name ! ”
44009015	But the Lord said to him , “ Go , because this man is my chosen instrument to carry my name before Gentiles and kings and the people of Israel .
44009016	For I will show him how much he must suffer for the sake of my name . ”
44009017	So Ananias departed and entered the house , placed his hands on Saul and said , “ Brother Saul , the Lord Jesus , who appeared to you on the road as you came here , has sent me so that you may see again and be filled with the Holy Spirit . ”
44009018	Immediately something like scales fell from his eyes , and he could see again . He got up and was baptized ,
44009019	and after taking some food , his strength returned . For several days he was with the disciples in Damascus ,
44009020	and immediately he began to proclaim Jesus in the synagogues , saying , “ This man is the Son of God . ”
44009021	All who heard him were amazed and were saying , “ Is this not the man who in Jerusalem was ravaging those who call on this name , and who had come here to bring them as prisoners to the chief priests ? ”
44009022	But Saul became more and more capable , and was causing consternation among the Jews who lived in Damascus by proving that Jesus is the Christ .
44009023	Now after some days had passed , the Jews plotted together to kill him ,
44009024	but Saul learned of their plot against him . They were also watching the city gates day and night so that they could kill him .
44009025	But his disciples took him at night and let him down through an opening in the wall by lowering him in a basket .
44009026	When he arrived in Jerusalem , he attempted to associate with the disciples , and they were all afraid of him , because they did not believe that he was a disciple .
44009027	But Barnabas took Saul , brought him to the apostles , and related to them how he had seen the Lord on the road , that the Lord had spoken to him , and how in Damascus he had spoken out boldly in the name of Jesus .
44009028	So he was staying with them , associating openly with them in Jerusalem , speaking out boldly in the name of the Lord .
44009029	He was speaking and debating with the Greek-speaking Jews , but they were trying to kill him .
44009030	When the brothers found out about this , they brought him down to Caesarea and sent him away to Tarsus .
44009031	Then the church throughout Judea , Galilee , and Samaria experienced peace and thus was strengthened . Living in the fear of the Lord and in the encouragement of the Holy Spirit , the church increased in numbers .
44009032	Now as Peter was traveling around from place to place , he also came down to the saints who lived in Lydda .
44009033	He found there a man named Aeneas who had been confined to a mattress for eight years because he was paralyzed .
44009034	Peter said to him , “ Aeneas , Jesus the Christ heals you . Get up and make your own bed ! ” And immediately he got up .
44009035	All those who lived in Lydda and Sharon saw him , and they turned to the Lord .
44009036	Now in Joppa there was a disciple named Tabitha ( which in translation means Dorcas ) . She was continually doing good deeds and acts of charity .
44009037	At that time she became sick and died . When they had washed her body , they placed it in an upstairs room .
44009038	Because Lydda was near Joppa , when the disciples heard that Peter was there , they sent two men to him and urged him , “ Come to us without delay . ”
44009039	So Peter got up and went with them , and when he arrived they brought him to the upper room . All the widows stood beside him , crying and showing him the tunics and other clothing Dorcas used to make while she was with them .
44009040	But Peter sent them all outside , knelt down , and prayed . Turning to the body , he said , “ Tabitha , get up . ” Then she opened her eyes , and when she saw Peter , she sat up .
44009041	He gave her his hand and helped her get up . Then he called the saints and widows and presented her alive .
44009042	This became known throughout all Joppa , and many believed in the Lord .
44009043	So Peter stayed many days in Joppa with a man named Simon , a tanner .
44010001	Now there was a man in Caesarea named Cornelius , a centurion of what was known as the Italian Cohort .
44010002	He was a devout , God-fearing man , as was all his household ; he did many acts of charity for the people and prayed to God regularly .
44010003	About three o’clock one afternoon he saw clearly in a vision an angel of God who came in and said to him , “ Cornelius . ”
44010004	Staring at him and becoming greatly afraid , Cornelius replied , “ What is it , Lord ? ” The angel said to him , “ Your prayers and your acts of charity have gone up as a memorial before God .
44010005	Now send men to Joppa and summon a man named Simon , who is called Peter .
44010006	This man is staying as a guest with a man named Simon , a tanner , whose house is by the sea . ”
44010007	When the angel who had spoken to him departed , Cornelius called two of his personal servants and a devout soldier from among those who served him ,
44010008	and when he had explained everything to them , he sent them to Joppa .
44010009	About noon the next day , while they were on their way and approaching the city , Peter went up on the roof to pray .
44010010	He became hungry and wanted to eat , but while they were preparing the meal , a trance came over him .
44010011	He saw heaven opened and an object something like a large sheet descending , being let down to earth by its four corners .
44010012	In it were all kinds of four-footed animals and reptiles of the earth and wild birds .
44010013	Then a voice said to him , “ Get up , Peter ; slaughter and eat ! ”
44010014	But Peter said , “ Certainly not , Lord , for I have never eaten anything defiled and ritually unclean ! ”
44010015	The voice spoke to him again , a second time , “ What God has made clean , you must not consider ritually unclean ! ”
44010016	This happened three times , and immediately the object was taken up into heaven .
44010017	Now while Peter was puzzling over what the vision he had seen could signify , the men sent by Cornelius had learned where Simon’s house was and approached the gate .
44010018	They called out to ask if Simon , known as Peter , was staying there as a guest .
44010019	While Peter was still thinking seriously about the vision , the Spirit said to him , “ Look ! Three men are looking for you .
44010020	But get up , go down , and accompany them without hesitation , because I have sent them . ”
44010021	So Peter went down to the men and said , “ Here I am , the person you’re looking for . Why have you come ? ”
44010022	They said , “ Cornelius the centurion , a righteous and God-fearing man , well spoken of by the whole Jewish nation , was directed by a holy angel to summon you to his house and to hear a message from you . ”
44010023	So Peter invited them in and entertained them as guests . On the next day he got up and set out with them , and some of the brothers from Joppa accompanied him .
44010024	The following day he entered Caesarea . Now Cornelius was waiting anxiously for them and had called together his relatives and close friends .
44010025	So when Peter came in , Cornelius met him , fell at his feet , and worshiped him .
44010026	But Peter helped him up , saying , “ Stand up . I too am a mere mortal . ”
44010027	Peter continued talking with him as he went in , and he found many people gathered together .
44010028	He said to them , “ You know that it is unlawful for a Jew to associate with or visit a Gentile , yet God has shown me that I should call no person defiled or ritually unclean .
44010029	Therefore when you sent for me , I came without any objection . Now may I ask why you sent for me ? ”
44010030	Cornelius replied , “ Four days ago at this very hour , at three o’clock in the afternoon , I was praying in my house , and suddenly a man in shining clothing stood before me
44010031	and said , ‘ Cornelius , your prayer has been heard and your acts of charity have been remembered before God .
44010032	Therefore send to Joppa and summon Simon , who is called Peter . This man is staying as a guest in the house of Simon the tanner , by the sea . ’
44010033	Therefore I sent for you at once , and you were kind enough to come . So now we are all here in the presence of God to listen to everything the Lord has commanded you to say to us . ”
44010034	Then Peter started speaking : “ I now truly understand that God does not show favoritism in dealing with people ,
44010035	but in every nation the person who fears him and does what is right is welcomed before him .
44010036	You know the message he sent to the people of Israel , proclaiming the good news of peace through Jesus Christ ( he is Lord of all ) –
44010037	you know what happened throughout Judea , beginning from Galilee after the baptism that John announced :
44010038	with respect to Jesus from Nazareth , that God anointed him with the Holy Spirit and with power . He went around doing good and healing all who were oppressed by the devil , because God was with him .
44010039	We are witnesses of all the things he did both in Judea and in Jerusalem . They killed him by hanging him on a tree ,
44010040	but God raised him up on the third day and caused him to be seen ,
44010041	not by all the people , but by us , the witnesses God had already chosen , who ate and drank with him after he rose from the dead .
44010042	He commanded us to preach to the people and to warn them that he is the one appointed by God as judge of the living and the dead .
44010043	About him all the prophets testify , that everyone who believes in him receives forgiveness of sins through his name . ”
44010044	While Peter was still speaking these words , the Holy Spirit fell on all those who heard the message .
44010045	The circumcised believers who had accompanied Peter were greatly astonished that the gift of the Holy Spirit had been poured out even on the Gentiles ,
44010046	for they heard them speaking in tongues and praising God . Then Peter said ,
44010047	“ No one can withhold the water for these people to be baptized , who have received the Holy Spirit just as we did , can he ? ”
44010048	So he gave orders to have them baptized in the name of Jesus Christ . Then they asked him to stay for several days .
44011001	Now the apostles and the brothers who were throughout Judea heard that the Gentiles too had accepted the word of God .
44011002	So when Peter went up to Jerusalem , the circumcised believers took issue with him ,
44011003	saying , “ You went to uncircumcised men and shared a meal with them . ”
44011004	But Peter began and explained it to them point by point , saying ,
44011005	“ I was in the city of Joppa praying , and in a trance I saw a vision , an object something like a large sheet descending , being let down from heaven by its four corners , and it came to me .
44011006	As I stared I looked into it and saw four-footed animals of the earth , wild animals , reptiles , and wild birds .
44011007	I also heard a voice saying to me , ‘ Get up , Peter ; slaughter and eat ! ’
44011008	But I said , ‘ Certainly not , Lord , for nothing defiled or ritually unclean has ever entered my mouth ! ’
44011009	But the voice replied a second time from heaven , ‘ What God has made clean , you must not consider ritually unclean ! ’
44011010	This happened three times , and then everything was pulled up to heaven again .
44011011	At that very moment , three men sent to me from Caesarea approached the house where we were staying .
44011012	The Spirit told me to accompany them without hesitation . These six brothers also went with me , and we entered the man’s house .
44011013	He informed us how he had seen an angel standing in his house and saying , ‘ Send to Joppa and summon Simon , who is called Peter ,
44011014	who will speak a message to you by which you and your entire household will be saved . ’
44011015	Then as I began to speak , the Holy Spirit fell on them just as he did on us at the beginning .
44011016	And I remembered the word of the Lord , as he used to say , ‘ John baptized with water , but you will be baptized with the Holy Spirit . ’
44011017	Therefore if God gave them the same gift as he also gave us after believing in the Lord Jesus Christ , who was I to hinder God ? ”
44011018	When they heard this , they ceased their objections and praised God , saying , “ So then , God has granted the repentance that leads to life even to the Gentiles . ”
44011019	Now those who had been scattered because of the persecution that took place over Stephen went as far as Phoenicia , Cyprus , and Antioch , speaking the message to no one but Jews .
44011020	But there were some men from Cyprus and Cyrene among them who came to Antioch and began to speak to the Greeks too , proclaiming the good news of the Lord Jesus .
44011021	The hand of the Lord was with them , and a great number who believed turned to the Lord .
44011022	A report about them came to the attention of the church in Jerusalem , and they sent Barnabas to Antioch .
44011023	When he came and saw the grace of God , he rejoiced and encouraged them all to remain true to the Lord with devoted hearts ,
44011024	because he was a good man , full of the Holy Spirit and of faith , and a significant number of people were brought to the Lord .
44011025	Then Barnabas departed for Tarsus to look for Saul ,
44011026	and when he found him , he brought him to Antioch . So for a whole year Barnabas and Saul met with the church and taught a significant number of people . Now it was in Antioch that the disciples were first called Christians .
44011027	At that time some prophets came down from Jerusalem to Antioch .
44011028	One of them , named Agabus , got up and predicted by the Spirit that a severe famine was about to come over the whole inhabited world . ( This took place during the reign of Claudius . )
44011029	So the disciples , each in accordance with his financial ability , decided to send relief to the brothers living in Judea .
44011030	They did so , sending their financial aid to the elders by Barnabas and Saul .
44012001	About that time King Herod laid hands on some from the church to harm them .
44012002	He had James , the brother of John , executed with a sword .
44012003	When he saw that this pleased the Jews , he proceeded to arrest Peter too . ( This took place during the feast of Unleavened Bread . )
44012004	When he had seized him , he put him in prison , handing him over to four squads of soldiers to guard him . Herod planned to bring him out for public trial after the Passover .
44012005	So Peter was kept in prison , but those in the church were earnestly praying to God for him .
44012006	On that very night before Herod was going to bring him out for trial , Peter was sleeping between two soldiers , bound with two chains , while guards in front of the door were keeping watch over the prison .
44012007	Suddenly an angel of the Lord appeared , and a light shone in the prison cell . He struck Peter on the side and woke him up , saying , “ Get up quickly ! ” And the chains fell off Peter’s wrists .
44012008	The angel said to him , “ Fasten your belt and put on your sandals . ” Peter did so . Then the angel said to him , “ Put on your cloak and follow me . ”
44012009	Peter went out and followed him ; he did not realize that what was happening through the angel was real , but thought he was seeing a vision .
44012010	After they had passed the first and second guards , they came to the iron gate leading into the city . It opened for them by itself , and they went outside and walked down one narrow street , when at once the angel left him .
44012011	When Peter came to himself , he said , “ Now I know for certain that the Lord has sent his angel and rescued me from the hand of Herod and from everything the Jewish people were expecting to happen . ”
44012012	When Peter realized this , he went to the house of Mary , the mother of John Mark , where many people had gathered together and were praying .
44012013	When he knocked at the door of the outer gate , a slave girl named Rhoda answered .
44012014	When she recognized Peter’s voice , she was so overjoyed she did not open the gate , but ran back in and told them that Peter was standing at the gate .
44012015	But they said to her , “ You’ve lost your mind ! ” But she kept insisting that it was Peter , and they kept saying , “ It is his angel ! ”
44012016	Now Peter continued knocking , and when they opened the door and saw him , they were greatly astonished .
44012017	He motioned to them with his hand to be quiet and then related how the Lord had brought him out of the prison . He said , “ Tell James and the brothers these things , ” and then he left and went to another place .
44012018	At daybreak there was great consternation among the soldiers over what had become of Peter .
44012019	When Herod had searched for him and did not find him , he questioned the guards and commanded that they be led away to execution . Then Herod went down from Judea to Caesarea and stayed there .
44012020	Now Herod was having an angry quarrel with the people of Tyre and Sidon . So they joined together and presented themselves before him . And after convincing Blastus , the king’s personal assistant , to help them , they asked for peace , because their country’s food supply was provided by the king’s country .
44012021	On a day determined in advance , Herod put on his royal robes , sat down on the judgment seat , and made a speech to them .
44012022	But the crowd began to shout , “ The voice of a god , and not of a man ! ”
44012023	Immediately an angel of the Lord struck Herod down because he did not give the glory to God , and he was eaten by worms and died .
44012024	But the word of God kept on increasing and multiplying .
44012025	So Barnabas and Saul returned to Jerusalem when they had completed their mission , bringing along with them John Mark .
44013001	Now there were these prophets and teachers in the church at Antioch : Barnabas , Simeon called Niger , Lucius the Cyrenian , Manaen ( a close friend of Herod the tetrarch from childhood ) and Saul .
44013002	While they were serving the Lord and fasting , the Holy Spirit said , “ Set apart for me Barnabas and Saul for the work to which I have called them . ”
44013003	Then , after they had fasted and prayed and placed their hands on them , they sent them off .
44013004	So Barnabas and Saul , sent out by the Holy Spirit , went down to Seleucia , and from there they sailed to Cyprus .
44013005	When they arrived in Salamis , they began to proclaim the word of God in the Jewish synagogues . ( Now they also had John as their assistant . )
44013006	When they had crossed over the whole island as far as Paphos , they found a magician , a Jewish false prophet named Bar-Jesus ,
44013007	who was with the proconsul Sergius Paulus , an intelligent man . The proconsul summoned Barnabas and Saul and wanted to hear the word of God .
44013008	But the magician Elymas ( for that is the way his name is translated ) opposed them , trying to turn the proconsul away from the faith .
44013009	But Saul ( also known as Paul ) , filled with the Holy Spirit , stared straight at him
44013010	and said , “ You who are full of all deceit and all wrongdoing , you son of the devil , you enemy of all righteousness – will you not stop making crooked the straight paths of the Lord ?
44013011	Now look , the hand of the Lord is against you , and you will be blind , unable to see the sun for a time ! ” Immediately mistiness and darkness came over him , and he went around seeking people to lead him by the hand .
44013012	Then when the proconsul saw what had happened , he believed , because he was greatly astounded at the teaching about the Lord .
44013013	Then Paul and his companions put out to sea from Paphos and came to Perga in Pamphylia , but John left them and returned to Jerusalem .
44013014	Moving on from Perga , they arrived at Pisidian Antioch , and on the Sabbath day they went into the synagogue and sat down .
44013015	After the reading from the law and the prophets , the leaders of the synagogue sent them a message , saying , “ Brothers , if you have any message of exhortation for the people , speak it . ”
44013016	So Paul stood up , gestured with his hand and said , “ Men of Israel , and you Gentiles who fear God , listen :
44013017	The God of this people Israel chose our ancestors and made the people great during their stay as foreigners in the country of Egypt , and with uplifted arm he led them out of it .
44013018	For a period of about forty years he put up with them in the wilderness .
44013019	After he had destroyed seven nations in the land of Canaan , he gave his people their land as an inheritance .
44013020	All this took about four hundred fifty years . After this he gave them judges until the time of Samuel the prophet .
44013021	Then they asked for a king , and God gave them Saul son of Kish , a man from the tribe of Benjamin , who ruled forty years .
44013022	After removing him , God raised up David their king . He testified about him : ‘ I have found David the son of Jesse to be a man after my heart , who will accomplish everything I want him to do . ’
44013023	From the descendants of this man God brought to Israel a Savior , Jesus , just as he promised .
44013024	Before Jesus arrived , John had proclaimed a baptism for repentance to all the people of Israel .
44013025	But while John was completing his mission , he said repeatedly , ‘ What do you think I am ? I am not he . But look , one is coming after me . I am not worthy to untie the sandals on his feet ! ’
44013026	Brothers , descendants of Abraham’s family , and those Gentiles among you who fear God , the message of this salvation has been sent to us .
44013027	For the people who live in Jerusalem and their rulers did not recognize him , and they fulfilled the sayings of the prophets that are read every Sabbath by condemning him .
44013028	Though they found no basis for a death sentence , they asked Pilate to have him executed .
44013029	When they had accomplished everything that was written about him , they took him down from the cross and placed him in a tomb .
44013030	But God raised him from the dead ,
44013031	and for many days he appeared to those who had accompanied him from Galilee to Jerusalem . These are now his witnesses to the people .
44013032	And we proclaim to you the good news about the promise to our ancestors ,
44013033	that this promise God has fulfilled to us , their children , by raising Jesus , as also it is written in the second psalm , ‘ You are my Son ; today I have fathered you . ’
44013034	But regarding the fact that he has raised Jesus from the dead , never again to be in a state of decay , God has spoken in this way : ‘ I will give you the holy and trustworthy promises made to David . ’
44013035	Therefore he also says in another psalm , ‘ You will not permit your Holy One to experience decay . ’
44013036	For David , after he had served God’s purpose in his own generation , died , was buried with his ancestors , and experienced decay ,
44013037	but the one whom God raised up did not experience decay .
44013038	Therefore let it be known to you , brothers , that through this one forgiveness of sins is proclaimed to you ,
44013039	and by this one everyone who believes is justified from everything from which the law of Moses could not justify you .
44013040	Watch out , then , that what is spoken about by the prophets does not happen to you :
44013041	‘ Look , you scoffers ; be amazed and perish ! For I am doing a work in your days , a work you would never believe , even if someone tells you . ’ ”
44013042	As Paul and Barnabas were going out , the people were urging them to speak about these things on the next Sabbath .
44013043	When the meeting of the synagogue had broken up , many of the Jews and God-fearing proselytes followed Paul and Barnabas , who were speaking with them and were persuading them to continue in the grace of God .
44013044	On the next Sabbath almost the whole city assembled together to hear the word of the Lord .
44013045	But when the Jews saw the crowds , they were filled with jealousy , and they began to contradict what Paul was saying by reviling him .
44013046	Both Paul and Barnabas replied courageously , “ It was necessary to speak the word of God to you first . Since you reject it and do not consider yourselves worthy of eternal life , we are turning to the Gentiles .
44013047	For this is what the Lord has commanded us : ‘ I have appointed you to be a light for the Gentiles , to bring salvation to the ends of the earth . ’ ”
44013048	When the Gentiles heard this , they began to rejoice and praise the word of the Lord , and all who had been appointed for eternal life believed .
44013049	So the word of the Lord was spreading through the entire region .
44013050	But the Jews incited the God-fearing women of high social standing and the prominent men of the city , stirred up persecution against Paul and Barnabas , and threw them out of their region .
44013051	So after they shook the dust off their feet in protest against them , they went to Iconium .
44013052	And the disciples were filled with joy and with the Holy Spirit .
44014001	The same thing happened in Iconium when Paul and Barnabas went into the Jewish synagogue and spoke in such a way that a large group of both Jews and Greeks believed .
44014002	But the Jews who refused to believe stirred up the Gentiles and poisoned their minds against the brothers .
44014003	So they stayed there for a considerable time , speaking out courageously for the Lord , who testified to the message of his grace , granting miraculous signs and wonders to be performed through their hands .
44014004	But the population of the city was divided ; some sided with the Jews , and some with the apostles .
44014005	When both the Gentiles and the Jews ( together with their rulers ) made an attempt to mistreat them and stone them ,
44014006	Paul and Barnabas learned about it and fled to the Lycaonian cities of Lystra and Derbe and the surrounding region .
44014007	There they continued to proclaim the good news .
44014008	In Lystra sat a man who could not use his feet , lame from birth , who had never walked .
44014009	This man was listening to Paul as he was speaking . When Paul stared intently at him and saw he had faith to be healed ,
44014010	he said with a loud voice , “ Stand upright on your feet . ” And the man leaped up and began walking .
44014011	So when the crowds saw what Paul had done , they shouted in the Lycaonian language , “ The gods have come down to us in human form ! ”
44014012	They began to call Barnabas Zeus and Paul Hermes , because he was the chief speaker .
44014013	The priest of the temple of Zeus , located just outside the city , brought bulls and garlands to the city gates ; he and the crowds wanted to offer sacrifices to them .
44014014	But when the apostles Barnabas and Paul heard about it , they tore their clothes and rushed out into the crowd , shouting ,
44014015	“ Men , why are you doing these things ? We too are men , with human natures just like you ! We are proclaiming the good news to you , so that you should turn from these worthless things to the living God , who made the heaven , the earth , the sea , and everything that is in them .
44014016	In past generations he allowed all the nations to go their own ways ,
44014017	yet he did not leave himself without a witness by doing good , by giving you rain from heaven and fruitful seasons , satisfying you with food and your hearts with joy . ”
44014018	Even by saying these things , they scarcely persuaded the crowds not to offer sacrifice to them .
44014019	But Jews came from Antioch and Iconium , and after winning the crowds over , they stoned Paul and dragged him out of the city , presuming him to be dead .
44014020	But after the disciples had surrounded him , he got up and went back into the city . On the next day he left with Barnabas for Derbe .
44014021	After they had proclaimed the good news in that city and made many disciples , they returned to Lystra , to Iconium , and to Antioch .
44014022	They strengthened the souls of the disciples and encouraged them to continue in the faith , saying , “ We must enter the kingdom of God through many persecutions . ”
44014023	When they had appointed elders for them in the various churches , with prayer and fasting they entrusted them to the protection of the Lord in whom they had believed .
44014024	Then they passed through Pisidia and came into Pamphylia ,
44014025	and when they had spoken the word in Perga , they went down to Attalia .
44014026	From there they sailed back to Antioch , where they had been commended to the grace of God for the work they had now completed .
44014027	When they arrived and gathered the church together , they reported all the things God had done with them , and that he had opened a door of faith for the Gentiles .
44014028	So they spent considerable time with the disciples .
44015001	Now some men came down from Judea and began to teach the brothers , “ Unless you are circumcised according to the custom of Moses , you cannot be saved . ”
44015002	When Paul and Barnabas had a major argument and debate with them , the church appointed Paul and Barnabas and some others from among them to go up to meet with the apostles and elders in Jerusalem about this point of disagreement .
44015003	So they were sent on their way by the church , and as they passed through both Phoenicia and Samaria , they were relating at length the conversion of the Gentiles and bringing great joy to all the brothers .
44015004	When they arrived in Jerusalem , they were received by the church and the apostles and the elders , and they reported all the things God had done with them .
44015005	But some from the religious party of the Pharisees who had believed stood up and said , “ It is necessary to circumcise the Gentiles and to order them to observe the law of Moses . ”
44015006	Both the apostles and the elders met together to deliberate about this matter .
44015007	After there had been much debate , Peter stood up and said to them , “ Brothers , you know that some time ago God chose me to preach to the Gentiles so they would hear the message of the gospel and believe .
44015008	And God , who knows the heart , has testified to them by giving them the Holy Spirit just as he did to us ,
44015009	and he made no distinction between them and us , cleansing their hearts by faith .
44015010	So now why are you putting God to the test by placing on the neck of the disciples a yoke that neither our ancestors nor we have been able to bear ?
44015011	On the contrary , we believe that we are saved through the grace of the Lord Jesus , in the same way as they are . ”
44015012	The whole group kept quiet and listened to Barnabas and Paul while they explained all the miraculous signs and wonders God had done among the Gentiles through them .
44015013	After they stopped speaking , James replied , “ Brothers , listen to me .
44015014	Simeon has explained how God first concerned himself to select from among the Gentiles a people for his name .
44015015	The words of the prophets agree with this , as it is written ,
44015016	‘ After this I will return , and I will rebuild the fallen tent of David ; I will rebuild its ruins and restore it ,
44015017	so that the rest of humanity may seek the Lord , namely , all the Gentiles I have called to be my own , ’ says the Lord , who makes these things
44015018	known from long ago .
44015019	“ Therefore I conclude that we should not cause extra difficulty for those among the Gentiles who are turning to God ,
44015020	but that we should write them a letter telling them to abstain from things defiled by idols and from sexual immorality and from what has been strangled and from blood .
44015021	For Moses has had those who proclaim him in every town from ancient times , because he is read aloud in the synagogues every Sabbath . ”
44015022	Then the apostles and elders , with the whole church , decided to send men chosen from among them , Judas called Barsabbas and Silas , leaders among the brothers , to Antioch with Paul and Barnabas .
44015023	They sent this letter with them :
44015030	So when they were dismissed , they went down to Antioch , and after gathering the entire group together , they delivered the letter .
44015031	When they read it aloud , the people rejoiced at its encouragement .
44015032	Both Judas and Silas , who were prophets themselves , encouraged and strengthened the brothers with a long speech .
44015033	After they had spent some time there , they were sent off in peace by the brothers to those who had sent them .
44015035	But Paul and Barnabas remained in Antioch , teaching and proclaiming ( along with many others ) the word of the Lord .
44015036	After some days Paul said to Barnabas , “ Let’s return and visit the brothers in every town where we proclaimed the word of the Lord to see how they are doing . ”
44015037	Barnabas wanted to bring John called Mark along with them too ,
44015038	but Paul insisted that they should not take along this one who had left them in Pamphylia and had not accompanied them in the work .
44015039	They had a sharp disagreement , so that they parted company . Barnabas took along Mark and sailed away to Cyprus ,
44015040	but Paul chose Silas and set out , commended to the grace of the Lord by the brothers and sisters .
44015041	He passed through Syria and Cilicia , strengthening the churches .
44016001	He also came to Derbe and to Lystra . A disciple named Timothy was there , the son of a Jewish woman who was a believer , but whose father was a Greek .
44016002	The brothers in Lystra and Iconium spoke well of him .
44016003	Paul wanted Timothy to accompany him , and he took him and circumcised him because of the Jews who were in those places , for they all knew that his father was Greek .
44016004	As they went through the towns , they passed on the decrees that had been decided on by the apostles and elders in Jerusalem for the Gentile believers to obey .
44016005	So the churches were being strengthened in the faith and were increasing in number every day .
44016006	They went through the region of Phrygia and Galatia , having been prevented by the Holy Spirit from speaking the message in the province of Asia .
44016007	When they came to Mysia , they attempted to go into Bithynia , but the Spirit of Jesus did not allow them to do this ,
44016008	so they passed through Mysia and went down to Troas .
44016009	A vision appeared to Paul during the night : A Macedonian man was standing there urging him , “ Come over to Macedonia and help us ! ”
44016010	After Paul saw the vision , we attempted immediately to go over to Macedonia , concluding that God had called us to proclaim the good news to them .
44016011	We put out to sea from Troas and sailed a straight course to Samothrace , the next day to Neapolis ,
44016012	and from there to Philippi , which is a leading city of that district of Macedonia , a Roman colony . We stayed in this city for some days .
44016013	On the Sabbath day we went outside the city gate to the side of the river , where we thought there would be a place of prayer , and we sat down and began to speak to the women who had assembled there .
44016014	A woman named Lydia , a dealer in purple cloth from the city of Thyatira , a God-fearing woman , listened to us . The Lord opened her heart to respond to what Paul was saying .
44016015	After she and her household were baptized , she urged us , “ If you consider me to be a believer in the Lord , come and stay in my house . ” And she persuaded us .
44016016	Now as we were going to the place of prayer , a slave girl met us who had a spirit that enabled her to foretell the future by supernatural means . She brought her owners a great profit by fortune-telling .
44016017	She followed behind Paul and us and kept crying out , “ These men are servants of the Most High God , who are proclaiming to you the way of salvation . ”
44016018	She continued to do this for many days . But Paul became greatly annoyed , and turned and said to the spirit , “ I command you in the name of Jesus Christ to come out of her ! ” And it came out of her at once .
44016019	But when her owners saw their hope of profit was gone , they seized Paul and Silas and dragged them into the marketplace before the authorities .
44016020	When they had brought them before the magistrates , they said , “ These men are throwing our city into confusion . They are Jews
44016021	and are advocating customs that are not lawful for us to accept or practice , since we are Romans . ”
44016022	The crowd joined the attack against them , and the magistrates tore the clothes off Paul and Silas and ordered them to be beaten with rods .
44016023	After they had beaten them severely , they threw them into prison and commanded the jailer to guard them securely .
44016024	Receiving such orders , he threw them in the inner cell and fastened their feet in the stocks .
44016025	About midnight Paul and Silas were praying and singing hymns to God , and the rest of the prisoners were listening to them .
44016026	Suddenly a great earthquake occurred , so that the foundations of the prison were shaken . Immediately all the doors flew open , and the bonds of all the prisoners came loose .
44016027	When the jailer woke up and saw the doors of the prison standing open , he drew his sword and was about to kill himself , because he assumed the prisoners had escaped .
44016028	But Paul called out loudly , “ Do not harm yourself , for we are all here ! ”
44016029	Calling for lights , the jailer rushed in and fell down trembling at the feet of Paul and Silas .
44016030	Then he brought them outside and asked , “ Sirs , what must I do to be saved ? ”
44016031	They replied , “ Believe in the Lord Jesus and you will be saved , you and your household . ”
44016032	Then they spoke the word of the Lord to him , along with all those who were in his house .
44016033	At that hour of the night he took them and washed their wounds ; then he and all his family were baptized right away .
44016034	The jailer brought them into his house and set food before them , and he rejoiced greatly that he had come to believe in God , together with his entire household .
44016035	At daybreak the magistrates sent their police officers , saying , “ Release those men . ”
44016036	The jailer reported these words to Paul , saying , “ The magistrates have sent orders to release you . So come out now and go in peace . ”
44016037	But Paul said to the police officers , “ They had us beaten in public without a proper trial – even though we are Roman citizens – and they threw us in prison . And now they want to send us away secretly ? Absolutely not ! They themselves must come and escort us out ! ”
44016038	The police officers reported these words to the magistrates . They were frightened when they heard Paul and Silas were Roman citizens
44016039	and came and apologized to them . After they brought them out , they asked them repeatedly to leave the city .
44016040	When they came out of the prison , they entered Lydia’s house , and when they saw the brothers , they encouraged them and then departed .
44017001	After they traveled through Amphipolis and Apollonia , they came to Thessalonica , where there was a Jewish synagogue .
44017002	Paul went to the Jews in the synagogue , as he customarily did , and on three Sabbath days he addressed them from the scriptures ,
44017003	explaining and demonstrating that the Christ had to suffer and to rise from the dead , saying , “ This Jesus I am proclaiming to you is the Christ . ”
44017004	Some of them were persuaded and joined Paul and Silas , along with a large group of God-fearing Greeks and quite a few prominent women .
44017005	But the Jews became jealous , and gathering together some worthless men from the rabble in the marketplace , they formed a mob and set the city in an uproar . They attacked Jason’s house , trying to find Paul and Silas to bring them out to the assembly .
44017006	When they did not find them , they dragged Jason and some of the brothers before the city officials , screaming , “ These people who have stirred up trouble throughout the world have come here too ,
44017007	and Jason has welcomed them as guests ! They are all acting against Caesar’s decrees , saying there is another king named Jesus ! ”
44017008	They caused confusion among the crowd and the city officials who heard these things .
44017009	After the city officials had received bail from Jason and the others , they released them .
44017010	The brothers sent Paul and Silas off to Berea at once , during the night . When they arrived , they went to the Jewish synagogue .
44017011	These Jews were more open-minded than those in Thessalonica , for they eagerly received the message , examining the scriptures carefully every day to see if these things were so .
44017012	Therefore many of them believed , along with quite a few prominent Greek women and men .
44017013	But when the Jews from Thessalonica heard that Paul had also proclaimed the word of God in Berea , they came there too , inciting and disturbing the crowds .
44017014	Then the brothers sent Paul away to the coast at once , but Silas and Timothy remained in Berea .
44017015	Those who accompanied Paul escorted him as far as Athens , and after receiving an order for Silas and Timothy to come to him as soon as possible , they left .
44017016	While Paul was waiting for them in Athens , his spirit was greatly upset because he saw the city was full of idols .
44017017	So he was addressing the Jews and the God-fearing Gentiles in the synagogue , and in the marketplace every day those who happened to be there .
44017018	Also some of the Epicurean and Stoic philosophers were conversing with him , and some were asking , “ What does this foolish babbler want to say ? ” Others said , “ He seems to be a proclaimer of foreign gods . ” ( They said this because he was proclaiming the good news about Jesus and the resurrection . )
44017019	So they took Paul and brought him to the Areopagus , saying , “ May we know what this new teaching is that you are proclaiming ?
44017020	For you are bringing some surprising things to our ears , so we want to know what they mean . ”
44017021	( All the Athenians and the foreigners who lived there used to spend their time in nothing else than telling or listening to something new . )
44017022	So Paul stood before the Areopagus and said , “ Men of Athens , I see that you are very religious in all respects .
44017023	For as I went around and observed closely your objects of worship , I even found an altar with this inscription : ‘ To an unknown god . ’ Therefore what you worship without knowing it , this I proclaim to you .
44017024	The God who made the world and everything in it , who is Lord of heaven and earth , does not live in temples made by human hands ,
44017025	nor is he served by human hands , as if he needed anything , because he himself gives life and breath and everything to everyone .
44017026	From one man he made every nation of the human race to inhabit the entire earth , determining their set times and the fixed limits of the places where they would live ,
44017027	so that they would search for God and perhaps grope around for him and find him , though he is not far from each one of us .
44017028	For in him we live and move about and exist , as even some of your own poets have said , ‘ For we too are his offspring . ’
44017029	So since we are God’s offspring , we should not think the deity is like gold or silver or stone , an image made by human skill and imagination .
44017030	Therefore , although God has overlooked such times of ignorance , he now commands all people everywhere to repent ,
44017031	because he has set a day on which he is going to judge the world in righteousness , by a man whom he designated , having provided proof to everyone by raising him from the dead . ”
44017032	Now when they heard about the resurrection from the dead , some began to scoff , but others said , “ We will hear you again about this . ”
44017033	So Paul left the Areopagus .
44017034	But some people joined him and believed . Among them were Dionysius , who was a member of the Areopagus , a woman named Damaris , and others with them .
44018001	After this Paul departed from Athens and went to Corinth .
44018002	There he found a Jew named Aquila , a native of Pontus , who had recently come from Italy with his wife Priscilla , because Claudius had ordered all the Jews to depart from Rome . Paul approached them ,
44018003	and because he worked at the same trade , he stayed with them and worked with them ( for they were tentmakers by trade ) .
44018004	He addressed both Jews and Greeks in the synagogue every Sabbath , attempting to persuade them .
44018005	Now when Silas and Timothy arrived from Macedonia , Paul became wholly absorbed with proclaiming the word , testifying to the Jews that Jesus was the Christ .
44018006	When they opposed him and reviled him , he protested by shaking out his clothes and said to them , “ Your blood be on your own heads ! I am guiltless ! From now on I will go to the Gentiles ! ”
44018007	Then Paul left the synagogue and went to the house of a person named Titius Justus , a Gentile who worshiped God , whose house was next door to the synagogue .
44018008	Crispus , the president of the synagogue , believed in the Lord together with his entire household , and many of the Corinthians who heard about it believed and were baptized .
44018009	The Lord said to Paul by a vision in the night , “ Do not be afraid , but speak and do not be silent ,
44018010	because I am with you , and no one will assault you to harm you , because I have many people in this city . ”
44018011	So he stayed there a year and six months , teaching the word of God among them .
44018012	Now while Gallio was proconsul of Achaia , the Jews attacked Paul together and brought him before the judgment seat ,
44018013	saying , “ This man is persuading people to worship God in a way contrary to the law ! ”
44018014	But just as Paul was about to speak , Gallio said to the Jews , “ If it were a matter of some crime or serious piece of villainy , I would have been justified in accepting the complaint of you Jews ,
44018015	but since it concerns points of disagreement about words and names and your own law , settle it yourselves . I will not be a judge of these things ! ”
44018016	Then he had them forced away from the judgment seat .
44018017	So they all seized Sosthenes , the president of the synagogue , and began to beat him in front of the judgment seat . Yet none of these things were of any concern to Gallio .
44018018	Paul , after staying many more days in Corinth , said farewell to the brothers and sailed away to Syria accompanied by Priscilla and Aquila . He had his hair cut off at Cenchrea because he had made a vow .
44018019	When they reached Ephesus , Paul left Priscilla and Aquila behind there , but he himself went into the synagogue and addressed the Jews .
44018020	When they asked him to stay longer , he would not consent ,
44018021	but said farewell to them and added , “ I will come back to you again if God wills . ” Then he set sail from Ephesus ,
44018022	and when he arrived at Caesarea , he went up and greeted the church at Jerusalem and then went down to Antioch .
44018023	After he spent some time there , Paul left and went through the region of Galatia and Phrygia , strengthening all the disciples .
44018024	Now a Jew named Apollos , a native of Alexandria , arrived in Ephesus . He was an eloquent speaker , well-versed in the scriptures .
44018025	He had been instructed in the way of the Lord , and with great enthusiasm he spoke and taught accurately the facts about Jesus , although he knew only the baptism of John .
44018026	He began to speak out fearlessly in the synagogue , but when Priscilla and Aquila heard him , they took him aside and explained the way of God to him more accurately .
44018027	When Apollos wanted to cross over to Achaia , the brothers encouraged him and wrote to the disciples to welcome him . When he arrived , he assisted greatly those who had believed by grace ,
44018028	for he refuted the Jews vigorously in public debate , demonstrating from the scriptures that the Christ was Jesus .
44019001	While Apollos was in Corinth , Paul went through the inland regions and came to Ephesus . He found some disciples there
44019002	and said to them , “ Did you receive the Holy Spirit when you believed ? ” They replied , “ No , we have not even heard that there is a Holy Spirit . ”
44019003	So Paul said , “ Into what then were you baptized ? ” “ Into John’s baptism , ” they replied .
44019004	Paul said , “ John baptized with a baptism of repentance , telling the people to believe in the one who was to come after him , that is , in Jesus . ”
44019005	When they heard this , they were baptized in the name of the Lord Jesus ,
44019006	and when Paul placed his hands on them , the Holy Spirit came upon them , and they began to speak in tongues and to prophesy .
44019007	( Now there were about twelve men in all . )
44019008	So Paul entered the synagogue and spoke out fearlessly for three months , addressing and convincing them about the kingdom of God .
44019009	But when some were stubborn and refused to believe , reviling the Way before the congregation , he left them and took the disciples with him , addressing them every day in the lecture hall of Tyrannus .
44019010	This went on for two years , so that all who lived in the province of Asia , both Jews and Greeks , heard the word of the Lord .
44019011	God was performing extraordinary miracles by Paul’s hands ,
44019012	so that when even handkerchiefs or aprons that had touched his body were brought to the sick , their diseases left them and the evil spirits went out of them .
44019013	But some itinerant Jewish exorcists tried to invoke the name of the Lord Jesus over those who were possessed by evil spirits , saying , “ I sternly warn you by Jesus whom Paul preaches . ”
44019014	( Now seven sons of a man named Sceva , a Jewish high priest , were doing this . )
44019015	But the evil spirit replied to them , “ I know about Jesus and I am acquainted with Paul , but who are you ? ”
44019016	Then the man who was possessed by the evil spirit jumped on them and beat them all into submission . He prevailed against them so that they fled from that house naked and wounded .
44019017	This became known to all who lived in Ephesus , both Jews and Greeks ; fear came over them all , and the name of the Lord Jesus was praised .
44019018	Many of those who had believed came forward , confessing and making their deeds known .
44019019	Large numbers of those who had practiced magic collected their books and burned them up in the presence of everyone . When the value of the books was added up , it was found to total fifty thousand silver coins .
44019020	In this way the word of the Lord continued to grow in power and to prevail .
44019021	Now after all these things had taken place , Paul resolved to go to Jerusalem , passing through Macedonia and Achaia . He said , “ After I have been there , I must also see Rome . ”
44019022	So after sending two of his assistants , Timothy and Erastus , to Macedonia , he himself stayed on for a while in the province of Asia .
44019023	At that time a great disturbance took place concerning the Way .
44019024	For a man named Demetrius , a silversmith who made silver shrines of Artemis , brought a great deal of business to the craftsmen .
44019025	He gathered these together , along with the workmen in similar trades , and said , “ Men , you know that our prosperity comes from this business .
44019026	And you see and hear that this Paul has persuaded and turned away a large crowd , not only in Ephesus but in practically all of the province of Asia , by saying that gods made by hands are not gods at all .
44019027	There is danger not only that this business of ours will come into disrepute , but also that the temple of the great goddess Artemis will be regarded as nothing , and she whom all the province of Asia and the world worship will suffer the loss of her greatness . ”
44019028	When they heard this they became enraged and began to shout , “ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ”
44019029	The city was filled with the uproar , and the crowd rushed to the theater together , dragging with them Gaius and Aristarchus , the Macedonians who were Paul’s traveling companions .
44019030	But when Paul wanted to enter the public assembly , the disciples would not let him .
44019031	Even some of the provincial authorities who were his friends sent a message to him , urging him not to venture into the theater .
44019032	So then some were shouting one thing , some another , for the assembly was in confusion , and most of them did not know why they had met together .
44019033	Some of the crowd concluded it was about Alexander because the Jews had pushed him to the front . Alexander , gesturing with his hand , was wanting to make a defense before the public assembly .
44019034	But when they recognized that he was a Jew , they all shouted in unison , “ Great is Artemis of the Ephesians ! ” for about two hours .
44019035	After the city secretary quieted the crowd , he said , “ Men of Ephesus , what person is there who does not know that the city of the Ephesians is the keeper of the temple of the great Artemis and of her image that fell from heaven ?
44019036	So because these facts are indisputable , you must keep quiet and not do anything reckless .
44019037	For you have brought these men here who are neither temple robbers nor blasphemers of our goddess .
44019038	If then Demetrius and the craftsmen who are with him have a complaint against someone , the courts are open and there are proconsuls ; let them bring charges against one another there .
44019039	But if you want anything in addition , it will have to be settled in a legal assembly .
44019040	For we are in danger of being charged with rioting today , since there is no cause we can give to explain this disorderly gathering . ”
44019041	After he had said this , he dismissed the assembly .
44020001	After the disturbance had ended , Paul sent for the disciples , and after encouraging them and saying farewell , he left to go to Macedonia .
44020002	After he had gone through those regions and spoken many words of encouragement to the believers there , he came to Greece ,
44020003	where he stayed for three months . Because the Jews had made a plot against him as he was intending to sail for Syria , he decided to return through Macedonia .
44020004	Paul was accompanied by Sopater son of Pyrrhus from Berea , Aristarchus and Secundus from Thessalonica , Gaius from Derbe , and Timothy , as well as Tychicus and Trophimus from the province of Asia .
44020005	These had gone on ahead and were waiting for us in Troas .
44020006	We sailed away from Philippi after the days of Unleavened Bread , and within five days we came to the others in Troas , where we stayed for seven days .
44020007	On the first day of the week , when we met to break bread , Paul began to speak to the people , and because he intended to leave the next day , he extended his message until midnight .
44020008	( Now there were many lamps in the upstairs room where we were meeting . )
44020009	A young man named Eutychus , who was sitting in the window , was sinking into a deep sleep while Paul continued to speak for a long time . Fast asleep , he fell down from the third story and was picked up dead .
44020010	But Paul went down , threw himself on the young man , put his arms around him , and said , “ Do not be distressed , for he is still alive ! ”
44020011	Then Paul went back upstairs , and after he had broken bread and eaten , he talked with them a long time , until dawn . Then he left .
44020012	They took the boy home alive and were greatly comforted .
44020013	We went on ahead to the ship and put out to sea for Assos , intending to take Paul aboard there , for he had arranged it this way . He himself was intending to go there by land .
44020014	When he met us in Assos , we took him aboard and went to Mitylene .
44020015	We set sail from there , and on the following day we arrived off Chios . The next day we approached Samos , and the day after that we arrived at Miletus .
44020016	For Paul had decided to sail past Ephesus so as not to spend time in the province of Asia , for he was hurrying to arrive in Jerusalem , if possible , by the day of Pentecost .
44020017	From Miletus he sent a message to Ephesus , telling the elders of the church to come to him .
44020018	When they arrived , he said to them , “ You yourselves know how I lived the whole time I was with you , from the first day I set foot in the province of Asia ,
44020019	serving the Lord with all humility and with tears , and with the trials that happened to me because of the plots of the Jews .
44020020	You know that I did not hold back from proclaiming to you anything that would be helpful , and from teaching you publicly and from house to house ,
44020021	testifying to both Jews and Greeks about repentance toward God and faith in our Lord Jesus .
44020022	And now , compelled by the Spirit , I am going to Jerusalem without knowing what will happen to me there ,
44020023	except that the Holy Spirit warns me in town after town that imprisonment and persecutions are waiting for me .
44020024	But I do not consider my life worth anything to myself , so that I may finish my task and the ministry that I received from the Lord Jesus , to testify to the good news of God’s grace .
44020025	“ And now I know that none of you among whom I went around proclaiming the kingdom will see me again .
44020026	Therefore I declare to you today that I am innocent of the blood of you all .
44020027	For I did not hold back from announcing to you the whole purpose of God .
44020028	Watch out for yourselves and for all the flock of which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers , to shepherd the church of God that he obtained with the blood of his own Son .
44020029	I know that after I am gone fierce wolves will come in among you , not sparing the flock .
44020030	Even from among your own group men will arise , teaching perversions of the truth to draw the disciples away after them .
44020031	Therefore be alert , remembering that night and day for three years I did not stop warning each one of you with tears .
44020032	And now I entrust you to God and to the message of his grace . This message is able to build you up and give you an inheritance among all those who are sanctified .
44020033	I have desired no one’s silver or gold or clothing .
44020034	You yourselves know that these hands of mine provided for my needs and the needs of those who were with me .
44020035	By all these things , I have shown you that by working in this way we must help the weak , and remember the words of the Lord Jesus that he himself said , ‘ It is more blessed to give than to receive . ’ ”
44020036	When he had said these things , he knelt down with them all and prayed .
44020037	They all began to weep loudly , and hugged Paul and kissed him ,
44020038	especially saddened by what he had said , that they were not going to see him again . Then they accompanied him to the ship .
44021001	After we tore ourselves away from them , we put out to sea , and sailing a straight course , we came to Cos , on the next day to Rhodes , and from there to Patara .
44021002	We found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia , went aboard , and put out to sea .
44021003	After we sighted Cyprus and left it behind on our port side , we sailed on to Syria and put in at Tyre , because the ship was to unload its cargo there .
44021004	After we located the disciples , we stayed there seven days . They repeatedly told Paul through the Spirit not to set foot in Jerusalem .
44021005	When our time was over , we left and went on our way . All of them , with their wives and children , accompanied us outside of the city . After kneeling down on the beach and praying ,
44021006	we said farewell to one another . Then we went aboard the ship , and they returned to their own homes .
44021007	We continued the voyage from Tyre and arrived at Ptolemais , and when we had greeted the brothers , we stayed with them for one day .
44021008	On the next day we left and came to Caesarea , and entered the house of Philip the evangelist , who was one of the seven , and stayed with him .
44021009	( He had four unmarried daughters who prophesied . )
44021010	While we remained there for a number of days , a prophet named Agabus came down from Judea .
44021011	He came to us , took Paul’s belt , tied his own hands and feet with it , and said , “ The Holy Spirit says this : ‘ This is the way the Jews in Jerusalem will tie up the man whose belt this is , and will hand him over to the Gentiles . ’ ”
44021012	When we heard this , both we and the local people begged him not to go up to Jerusalem .
44021013	Then Paul replied , “ What are you doing , weeping and breaking my heart ? For I am ready not only to be tied up , but even to die in Jerusalem for the name of the Lord Jesus . ”
44021014	Because he could not be persuaded , we said no more except , “ The Lord’s will be done . ”
44021015	After these days we got ready and started up to Jerusalem .
44021016	Some of the disciples from Caesarea came along with us too , and brought us to the house of Mnason of Cyprus , a disciple from the earliest times , with whom we were to stay .
44021017	When we arrived in Jerusalem , the brothers welcomed us gladly .
44021018	The next day Paul went in with us to see James , and all the elders were there .
44021019	When Paul had greeted them , he began to explain in detail what God had done among the Gentiles through his ministry .
44021020	When they heard this , they praised God . Then they said to him , “ You see , brother , how many thousands of Jews there are who have believed , and they are all ardent observers of the law .
44021021	They have been informed about you – that you teach all the Jews now living among the Gentiles to abandon Moses , telling them not to circumcise their children or live according to our customs .
44021022	What then should we do ? They will no doubt hear that you have come .
44021023	So do what we tell you : We have four men who have taken a vow ;
44021024	take them and purify yourself along with them and pay their expenses , so that they may have their heads shaved . Then everyone will know there is nothing in what they have been told about you , but that you yourself live in conformity with the law .
44021025	But regarding the Gentiles who have believed , we have written a letter , having decided that they should avoid meat that has been sacrificed to idols and blood and what has been strangled and sexual immorality . ”
44021026	Then Paul took the men the next day , and after he had purified himself along with them , he went to the temple and gave notice of the completion of the days of purification , when the sacrifice would be offered for each of them .
44021027	When the seven days were almost over , the Jews from the province of Asia who had seen him in the temple area stirred up the whole crowd and seized him ,
44021028	shouting , “ Men of Israel , help ! This is the man who teaches everyone everywhere against our people , our law , and this sanctuary ! Furthermore he has brought Greeks into the inner courts of the temple and made this holy place ritually unclean ! ”
44021029	( For they had seen Trophimus the Ephesian in the city with him previously , and they assumed Paul had brought him into the inner temple courts . )
44021030	The whole city was stirred up , and the people rushed together . They seized Paul and dragged him out of the temple courts , and immediately the doors were shut .
44021031	While they were trying to kill him , a report was sent up to the commanding officer of the cohort that all Jerusalem was in confusion .
44021032	He immediately took soldiers and centurions and ran down to the crowd . When they saw the commanding officer and the soldiers , they stopped beating Paul .
44021033	Then the commanding officer came up and arrested him and ordered him to be tied up with two chains ; he then asked who he was and what he had done .
44021034	But some in the crowd shouted one thing , and others something else , and when the commanding officer was unable to find out the truth because of the disturbance , he ordered Paul to be brought into the barracks .
44021035	When he came to the steps , Paul had to be carried by the soldiers because of the violence of the mob ,
44021036	for a crowd of people followed them , screaming , “ Away with him ! ”
44021037	As Paul was about to be brought into the barracks , he said to the commanding officer , “ May I say something to you ? ” The officer replied , “ Do you know Greek ?
44021038	Then you’re not that Egyptian who started a rebellion and led the four thousand men of the ‘ Assassins’ into the wilderness some time ago ? ”
44021039	Paul answered , “ I am a Jew from Tarsus in Cilicia , a citizen of an important city . Please allow me to speak to the people . ”
44021040	When the commanding officer had given him permission , Paul stood on the steps and gestured to the people with his hand . When they had become silent , he addressed them in Aramaic ,
44022001	“ Brothers and fathers , listen to my defense that I now make to you . ”
44022002	( When they heard that he was addressing them in Aramaic , they became even quieter . ) Then Paul said ,
44022003	“ I am a Jew , born in Tarsus in Cilicia , but brought up in this city , educated with strictness under Gamaliel according to the law of our ancestors , and was zealous for God just as all of you are today .
44022004	I persecuted this Way even to the point of death , tying up both men and women and putting them in prison ,
44022005	as both the high priest and the whole council of elders can testify about me . From them I also received letters to the brothers in Damascus , and I was on my way to make arrests there and bring the prisoners to Jerusalem to be punished .
44022006	As I was en route and near Damascus , about noon a very bright light from heaven suddenly flashed around me .
44022007	Then I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? ’
44022008	I answered , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ He said to me , ‘ I am Jesus the Nazarene , whom you are persecuting . ’
44022009	Those who were with me saw the light , but did not understand the voice of the one who was speaking to me .
44022010	So I asked , ‘ What should I do , Lord ? ’ The Lord said to me , ‘ Get up and go to Damascus ; there you will be told about everything that you have been designated to do . ’
44022011	Since I could not see because of the brilliance of that light , I came to Damascus led by the hand of those who were with me .
44022012	A man named Ananias , a devout man according to the law , well spoken of by all the Jews who live there ,
44022013	came to me and stood beside me and said to me , ‘ Brother Saul , regain your sight ! ’ And at that very moment I looked up and saw him .
44022014	Then he said , ‘ The God of our ancestors has already chosen you to know his will , to see the Righteous One , and to hear a command from his mouth ,
44022015	because you will be his witness to all people of what you have seen and heard .
44022016	And now what are you waiting for ? Get up , be baptized , and have your sins washed away , calling on his name . ’
44022017	When I returned to Jerusalem and was praying in the temple , I fell into a trance
44022018	and saw the Lord saying to me , ‘ Hurry and get out of Jerusalem quickly , because they will not accept your testimony about me . ’
44022019	I replied , ‘ Lord , they themselves know that I imprisoned and beat those in the various synagogues who believed in you .
44022020	And when the blood of your witness Stephen was shed , I myself was standing nearby , approving , and guarding the cloaks of those who were killing him . ’
44022021	Then he said to me , ‘ Go , because I will send you far away to the Gentiles . ’ ”
44022022	The crowd was listening to him until he said this . Then they raised their voices and shouted , “ Away with this man from the earth ! For he should not be allowed to live ! ”
44022023	While they were screaming and throwing off their cloaks and tossing dust in the air ,
44022024	the commanding officer ordered Paul to be brought back into the barracks . He told them to interrogate Paul by beating him with a lash so that he could find out the reason the crowd was shouting at Paul in this way .
44022025	When they had stretched him out for the lash , Paul said to the centurion standing nearby , “ Is it legal for you to lash a man who is a Roman citizen without a proper trial ? ”
44022026	When the centurion heard this , he went to the commanding officer and reported it , saying , “ What are you about to do ? For this man is a Roman citizen . ”
44022027	So the commanding officer came and asked Paul , “ Tell me , are you a Roman citizen ? ” He replied , “ Yes . ”
44022028	The commanding officer answered , “ I acquired this citizenship with a large sum of money . ” “ But I was even born a citizen , ” Paul replied .
