44022029	Then those who were about to interrogate him stayed away from him , and the commanding officer was frightened when he realized that Paul was a Roman citizen and that he had had him tied up .
44022030	The next day , because the commanding officer wanted to know the true reason Paul was being accused by the Jews , he released him and ordered the chief priests and the whole council to assemble . He then brought Paul down and had him stand before them .
44023001	Paul looked directly at the council and said , “ Brothers , I have lived my life with a clear conscience before God to this day . ”
44023002	At that the high priest Ananias ordered those standing near Paul to strike him on the mouth .
44023003	Then Paul said to him , “ God is going to strike you , you whitewashed wall ! Do you sit there judging me according to the law , and in violation of the law you order me to be struck ? ”
44023004	Those standing near him said , “ Do you dare insult God’s high priest ? ”
44023005	Paul replied , “ I did not realize , brothers , that he was the high priest , for it is written , ‘ You must not speak evil about a ruler of your people . ’ ”
44023006	Then when Paul noticed that part of them were Sadducees and the others Pharisees , he shouted out in the council , “ Brothers , I am a Pharisee , a son of Pharisees . I am on trial concerning the hope of the resurrection of the dead ! ”
44023007	When he said this , an argument began between the Pharisees and the Sadducees , and the assembly was divided .
44023008	( For the Sadducees say there is no resurrection , or angel , or spirit , but the Pharisees acknowledge them all . )
44023009	There was a great commotion , and some experts in the law from the party of the Pharisees stood up and protested strongly , “ We find nothing wrong with this man . What if a spirit or an angel has spoken to him ? ”
44023010	When the argument became so great the commanding officer feared that they would tear Paul to pieces , he ordered the detachment to go down , take him away from them by force , and bring him into the barracks .
44023011	The following night the Lord stood near Paul and said , “ Have courage , for just as you have testified about me in Jerusalem , so you must also testify in Rome . ”
44023012	When morning came , the Jews formed a conspiracy and bound themselves with an oath not to eat or drink anything until they had killed Paul .
44023013	There were more than forty of them who formed this conspiracy .
44023014	They went to the chief priests and the elders and said , “ We have bound ourselves with a solemn oath not to partake of anything until we have killed Paul .
44023015	So now you and the council request the commanding officer to bring him down to you , as if you were going to determine his case by conducting a more thorough inquiry . We are ready to kill him before he comes near this place . ”
44023016	But when the son of Paul’s sister heard about the ambush , he came and entered the barracks and told Paul .
44023017	Paul called one of the centurions and said , “ Take this young man to the commanding officer , for he has something to report to him . ”
44023018	So the centurion took him and brought him to the commanding officer and said , “ The prisoner Paul called me and asked me to bring this young man to you because he has something to tell you . ”
44023019	The commanding officer took him by the hand , withdrew privately , and asked , “ What is it that you want to report to me ? ”
44023020	He replied , “ The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul down to the council tomorrow , as if they were going to inquire more thoroughly about him .
44023021	So do not let them persuade you to do this , because more than forty of them are lying in ambush for him . They have bound themselves with an oath not to eat or drink anything until they have killed him , and now they are ready , waiting for you to agree to their request . ”
44023022	Then the commanding officer sent the young man away , directing him , “ Tell no one that you have reported these things to me . ”
44023023	Then he summoned two of the centurions and said , “ Make ready two hundred soldiers to go to Caesarea along with seventy horsemen and two hundred spearmen by nine o’clock tonight ,
44023024	and provide mounts for Paul to ride so that he may be brought safely to Felix the governor . ”
44023025	He wrote a letter that went like this :
44023031	So the soldiers , in accordance with their orders , took Paul and brought him to Antipatris during the night .
44023032	The next day they let the horsemen go on with him , and they returned to the barracks .
44023033	When the horsemen came to Caesarea and delivered the letter to the governor , they also presented Paul to him .
44023034	When the governor had read the letter , he asked what province he was from . When he learned that he was from Cilicia ,
44023035	he said , “ I will give you a hearing when your accusers arrive too . ” Then he ordered that Paul be kept under guard in Herod’s palace .
44024001	After five days the high priest Ananias came down with some elders and an attorney named Tertullus , and they brought formal charges against Paul to the governor .
44024002	When Paul had been summoned , Tertullus began to accuse him , saying , “ We have experienced a lengthy time of peace through your rule , and reforms are being made in this nation through your foresight .
44024003	Most excellent Felix , we acknowledge this everywhere and in every way with all gratitude .
44024004	But so that I may not delay you any further , I beg you to hear us briefly with your customary graciousness .
44024005	For we have found this man to be a troublemaker , one who stirs up riots among all the Jews throughout the world , and a ringleader of the sect of the Nazarenes .
44024006	He even tried to desecrate the temple , so we arrested him .
44024008	When you examine him yourself , you will be able to learn from him about all these things we are accusing him of doing . ”
44024009	The Jews also joined in the verbal attack , claiming that these things were true .
44024010	When the governor gestured for him to speak , Paul replied , “ Because I know that you have been a judge over this nation for many years , I confidently make my defense .
44024011	As you can verify for yourself , not more than twelve days ago I went up to Jerusalem to worship .
44024012	They did not find me arguing with anyone or stirring up a crowd in the temple courts or in the synagogues or throughout the city ,
44024013	nor can they prove to you the things they are accusing me of doing .
44024014	But I confess this to you , that I worship the God of our ancestors according to the Way ( which they call a sect ) , believing everything that is according to the law and that is written in the prophets .
44024015	I have a hope in God ( a hope that these men themselves accept too ) that there is going to be a resurrection of both the righteous and the unrighteous .
44024016	This is the reason I do my best to always have a clear conscience toward God and toward people .
44024017	After several years I came to bring to my people gifts for the poor and to present offerings ,
44024018	which I was doing when they found me in the temple , ritually purified , without a crowd or a disturbance .
44024019	But there are some Jews from the province of Asia who should be here before you and bring charges , if they have anything against me .
44024020	Or these men here should tell what crime they found me guilty of when I stood before the council ,
44024021	other than this one thing I shouted out while I stood before them : ‘ I am on trial before you today concerning the resurrection of the dead . ’ ”
44024022	Then Felix , who understood the facts concerning the Way more accurately , adjourned their hearing , saying , “ When Lysias the commanding officer comes down , I will decide your case . ”
44024023	He ordered the centurion to guard Paul , but to let him have some freedom , and not to prevent any of his friends from meeting his needs .
44024024	Some days later , when Felix arrived with his wife Drusilla , who was Jewish , he sent for Paul and heard him speak about faith in Christ Jesus .
44024025	While Paul was discussing righteousness , self-control , and the coming judgment , Felix became frightened and said , “ Go away for now , and when I have an opportunity , I will send for you . ”
44024026	At the same time he was also hoping that Paul would give him money , and for this reason he sent for Paul as often as possible and talked with him .
44024027	After two years had passed , Porcius Festus succeeded Felix , and because he wanted to do the Jews a favor , Felix left Paul in prison .
44025001	Now three days after Festus arrived in the province , he went up to Jerusalem from Caesarea .
44025002	So the chief priests and the most prominent men of the Jews brought formal charges against Paul to him .
44025003	Requesting him to do them a favor against Paul , they urged Festus to summon him to Jerusalem , planning an ambush to kill him along the way .
44025004	Then Festus replied that Paul was being kept at Caesarea , and he himself intended to go there shortly .
44025005	“ So , ” he said , “ let your leaders go down there with me , and if this man has done anything wrong , they may bring charges against him . ”
44025006	After Festus had stayed not more than eight or ten days among them , he went down to Caesarea , and the next day he sat on the judgment seat and ordered Paul to be brought .
44025007	When he arrived , the Jews who had come down from Jerusalem stood around him , bringing many serious charges that they were not able to prove .
44025008	Paul said in his defense , “ I have committed no offense against the Jewish law or against the temple or against Caesar . ”
44025009	But Festus , wanting to do the Jews a favor , asked Paul , “ Are you willing to go up to Jerusalem and be tried before me there on these charges ? ”
44025010	Paul replied , “ I am standing before Caesar’s judgment seat , where I should be tried . I have done nothing wrong to the Jews , as you also know very well .
44025011	If then I am in the wrong and have done anything that deserves death , I am not trying to escape dying , but if not one of their charges against me is true , no one can hand me over to them . I appeal to Caesar ! ”
44025012	Then , after conferring with his council , Festus replied , “ You have appealed to Caesar ; to Caesar you will go ! ”
44025013	After several days had passed , King Agrippa and Bernice arrived at Caesarea to pay their respects to Festus .
44025014	While they were staying there many days , Festus explained Paul’s case to the king to get his opinion , saying , “ There is a man left here as a prisoner by Felix .
44025015	When I was in Jerusalem , the chief priests and the elders of the Jews informed me about him , asking for a sentence of condemnation against him .
44025016	I answered them that it was not the custom of the Romans to hand over anyone before the accused had met his accusers face to face and had been given an opportunity to make a defense against the accusation .
44025017	So after they came back here with me , I did not postpone the case , but the next day I sat on the judgment seat and ordered the man to be brought .
44025018	When his accusers stood up , they did not charge him with any of the evil deeds I had suspected .
44025019	Rather they had several points of disagreement with him about their own religion and about a man named Jesus who was dead , whom Paul claimed to be alive .
44025020	Because I was at a loss how I could investigate these matters , I asked if he were willing to go to Jerusalem and be tried there on these charges .
44025021	But when Paul appealed to be kept in custody for the decision of His Majesty the Emperor , I ordered him to be kept under guard until I could send him to Caesar . ”
44025022	Agrippa said to Festus , “ I would also like to hear the man myself . ” “ Tomorrow , ” he replied , “ you will hear him . ”
44025023	So the next day Agrippa and Bernice came with great pomp and entered the audience hall , along with the senior military officers and the prominent men of the city . When Festus gave the order , Paul was brought in .
44025024	Then Festus said , “ King Agrippa , and all you who are present here with us , you see this man about whom the entire Jewish populace petitioned me both in Jerusalem and here , shouting loudly that he ought not to live any longer .
44025025	But I found that he had done nothing that deserved death , and when he appealed to His Majesty the Emperor , I decided to send him .
44025026	But I have nothing definite to write to my lord about him . Therefore I have brought him before you all , and especially before you , King Agrippa , so that after this preliminary hearing I may have something to write .
44025027	For it seems unreasonable to me to send a prisoner without clearly indicating the charges against him . ”
44026001	So Agrippa said to Paul , “ You have permission to speak for yourself . ” Then Paul held out his hand and began his defense :
44026002	“ Regarding all the things I have been accused of by the Jews , King Agrippa , I consider myself fortunate that I am about to make my defense before you today ,
44026003	because you are especially familiar with all the customs and controversial issues of the Jews . Therefore I ask you to listen to me patiently .
44026004	Now all the Jews know the way I lived from my youth , spending my life from the beginning among my own people and in Jerusalem .
44026005	They know , because they have known me from time past , if they are willing to testify , that according to the strictest party of our religion , I lived as a Pharisee .
44026006	And now I stand here on trial because of my hope in the promise made by God to our ancestors ,
44026007	a promise that our twelve tribes hope to attain as they earnestly serve God night and day . Concerning this hope the Jews are accusing me , Your Majesty !
44026008	Why do you people think it is unbelievable that God raises the dead ?
44026009	Of course , I myself was convinced that it was necessary to do many things hostile to the name of Jesus the Nazarene .
44026010	And that is what I did in Jerusalem : Not only did I lock up many of the saints in prisons by the authority I received from the chief priests , but I also cast my vote against them when they were sentenced to death .
44026011	I punished them often in all the synagogues and tried to force them to blaspheme . Because I was so furiously enraged at them , I went to persecute them even in foreign cities .
44026012	“ While doing this very thing , as I was going to Damascus with authority and complete power from the chief priests ,
44026013	about noon along the road , Your Majesty , I saw a light from heaven , brighter than the sun , shining everywhere around me and those traveling with me .
44026014	When we had all fallen to the ground , I heard a voice saying to me in Aramaic , ‘ Saul , Saul , why are you persecuting me ? You are hurting yourself by kicking against the goads . ’
44026015	So I said , ‘ Who are you , Lord ? ’ And the Lord replied , ‘ I am Jesus whom you are persecuting .
44026016	But get up and stand on your feet , for I have appeared to you for this reason , to designate you in advance as a servant and witness to the things you have seen and to the things in which I will appear to you .
44026017	I will rescue you from your own people and from the Gentiles , to whom I am sending you
44026018	to open their eyes so that they turn from darkness to light and from the power of Satan to God , so that they may receive forgiveness of sins and a share among those who are sanctified by faith in me . ’
44026019	“ Therefore , King Agrippa , I was not disobedient to the heavenly vision ,
44026020	but I declared to those in Damascus first , and then to those in Jerusalem and in all Judea , and to the Gentiles , that they should repent and turn to God , performing deeds consistent with repentance .
44026021	For this reason the Jews seized me in the temple courts and were trying to kill me .
44026022	I have experienced help from God to this day , and so I stand testifying to both small and great , saying nothing except what the prophets and Moses said was going to happen :
44026023	that the Christ was to suffer and be the first to rise from the dead , to proclaim light both to our people and to the Gentiles . ”
44026024	As Paul was saying these things in his defense , Festus exclaimed loudly , “ You have lost your mind , Paul ! Your great learning is driving you insane ! ”
44026025	But Paul replied , “ I have not lost my mind , most excellent Festus , but am speaking true and rational words .
44026026	For the king knows about these things , and I am speaking freely to him , because I cannot believe that any of these things has escaped his notice , for this was not done in a corner .
44026027	Do you believe the prophets , King Agrippa ? I know that you believe . ”
44026028	Agrippa said to Paul , “ In such a short time are you persuading me to become a Christian ? ”
44026029	Paul replied , “ I pray to God that whether in a short or a long time not only you but also all those who are listening to me today could become such as I am , except for these chains . ”
44026030	So the king got up , and with him the governor and Bernice and those sitting with them ,
44026031	and as they were leaving they said to one another , “ This man is not doing anything deserving death or imprisonment . ”
44026032	Agrippa said to Festus , “ This man could have been released if he had not appealed to Caesar . ”
44027001	When it was decided we would sail to Italy , they handed over Paul and some other prisoners to a centurion of the Augustan Cohort named Julius .
44027002	We went on board a ship from Adramyttium that was about to sail to various ports along the coast of the province of Asia and put out to sea , accompanied by Aristarchus , a Macedonian from Thessalonica .
44027003	The next day we put in at Sidon , and Julius , treating Paul kindly , allowed him to go to his friends so they could provide him with what he needed .
44027004	From there we put out to sea and sailed under the lee of Cyprus because the winds were against us .
44027005	After we had sailed across the open sea off Cilicia and Pamphylia , we put in at Myra in Lycia .
44027006	There the centurion found a ship from Alexandria sailing for Italy , and he put us aboard it .
44027007	We sailed slowly for many days and arrived with difficulty off Cnidus . Because the wind prevented us from going any farther , we sailed under the lee of Crete off Salmone .
44027008	With difficulty we sailed along the coast of Crete and came to a place called Fair Havens that was near the town of Lasea .
44027009	Since considerable time had passed and the voyage was now dangerous because the fast was already over , Paul advised them ,
44027010	“ Men , I can see the voyage is going to end in disaster and great loss not only of the cargo and the ship , but also of our lives . ”
44027011	But the centurion was more convinced by the captain and the ship’s owner than by what Paul said .
44027012	Because the harbor was not suitable to spend the winter in , the majority decided to put out to sea from there . They hoped that somehow they could reach Phoenix , a harbor of Crete facing southwest and northwest , and spend the winter there .
44027013	When a gentle south wind sprang up , they thought they could carry out their purpose , so they weighed anchor and sailed close along the coast of Crete .
44027014	Not long after this , a hurricane-force wind called the northeaster blew down from the island .
44027015	When the ship was caught in it and could not head into the wind , we gave way to it and were driven along .
44027016	As we ran under the lee of a small island called Cauda , we were able with difficulty to get the ship’s boat under control .
44027017	After the crew had hoisted it aboard , they used supports to undergird the ship . Fearing they would run aground on the Syrtis , they lowered the sea anchor , thus letting themselves be driven along .
44027018	The next day , because we were violently battered by the storm , they began throwing the cargo overboard ,
44027019	and on the third day they threw the ship’s gear overboard with their own hands .
44027020	When neither sun nor stars appeared for many days and a violent storm continued to batter us , we finally abandoned all hope of being saved .
44027021	Since many of them had no desire to eat , Paul stood up among them and said , “ Men , you should have listened to me and not put out to sea from Crete , thus avoiding this damage and loss .
44027022	And now I advise you to keep up your courage , for there will be no loss of life among you , but only the ship will be lost .
44027023	For last night an angel of the God to whom I belong and whom I serve came to me
44027024	and said , ‘ Do not be afraid , Paul ! You must stand before Caesar , and God has graciously granted you the safety of all who are sailing with you . ’
44027025	Therefore keep up your courage , men , for I have faith in God that it will be just as I have been told .
44027026	But we must run aground on some island . ”
44027027	When the fourteenth night had come , while we were being driven across the Adriatic Sea , about midnight the sailors suspected they were approaching some land .
44027028	They took soundings and found the water was twenty fathoms deep ; when they had sailed a little farther they took soundings again and found it was fifteen fathoms deep .
44027029	Because they were afraid that we would run aground on the rocky coast , they threw out four anchors from the stern and wished for day to appear .
44027030	Then when the sailors tried to escape from the ship and were lowering the ship’s boat into the sea , pretending that they were going to put out anchors from the bow ,
44027031	Paul said to the centurion and the soldiers , “ Unless these men stay with the ship , you cannot be saved . ”
44027032	Then the soldiers cut the ropes of the ship’s boat and let it drift away .
44027033	As day was about to dawn , Paul urged them all to take some food , saying , “ Today is the fourteenth day you have been in suspense and have gone without food ; you have eaten nothing .
44027034	Therefore I urge you to take some food , for this is important for your survival . For not one of you will lose a hair from his head . ”
44027035	After he said this , Paul took bread and gave thanks to God in front of them all , broke it , and began to eat .
44027036	So all of them were encouraged and took food themselves .
44027037	( We were in all two hundred seventy-six persons on the ship . )
44027038	When they had eaten enough to be satisfied , they lightened the ship by throwing the wheat into the sea .
44027039	When day came , they did not recognize the land , but they noticed a bay with a beach , where they decided to run the ship aground if they could .
44027040	So they slipped the anchors and left them in the sea , at the same time loosening the linkage that bound the steering oars together . Then they hoisted the foresail to the wind and steered toward the beach .
44027041	But they encountered a patch of crosscurrents and ran the ship aground ; the bow stuck fast and could not be moved , but the stern was being broken up by the force of the waves .
44027042	Now the soldiers’ plan was to kill the prisoners so that none of them would escape by swimming away .
44027043	But the centurion , wanting to save Paul’s life , prevented them from carrying out their plan . He ordered those who could swim to jump overboard first and get to land ,
44027044	and the rest were to follow , some on planks and some on pieces of the ship . And in this way all were brought safely to land .
44028001	After we had safely reached shore , we learned that the island was called Malta .
44028002	The local inhabitants showed us extraordinary kindness , for they built a fire and welcomed us all because it had started to rain and was cold .
44028003	When Paul had gathered a bundle of brushwood and was putting it on the fire , a viper came out because of the heat and fastened itself on his hand .
44028004	When the local people saw the creature hanging from Paul’s hand , they said to one another , “ No doubt this man is a murderer ! Although he has escaped from the sea , Justice herself has not allowed him to live ! ”
44028005	However , Paul shook the creature off into the fire and suffered no harm .
44028006	But they were expecting that he was going to swell up or suddenly drop dead . So after they had waited a long time and had seen nothing unusual happen to him , they changed their minds and said he was a god .
44028007	Now in the region around that place were fields belonging to the chief official of the island , named Publius , who welcomed us and entertained us hospitably as guests for three days .
44028008	The father of Publius lay sick in bed , suffering from fever and dysentery . Paul went in to see him and after praying , placed his hands on him and healed him .
44028009	After this had happened , many of the people on the island who were sick also came and were healed .
44028010	They also bestowed many honors , and when we were preparing to sail , they gave us all the supplies we needed .
44028011	After three months we put out to sea in an Alexandrian ship that had wintered at the island and had the “ Heavenly Twins ” as its figurehead .
44028012	We put in at Syracuse and stayed there three days .
44028013	From there we cast off and arrived at Rhegium , and after one day a south wind sprang up and on the second day we came to Puteoli .
44028014	There we found some brothers and were invited to stay with them seven days . And in this way we came to Rome .
44028015	The brothers from there , when they heard about us , came as far as the Forum of Appius and Three Taverns to meet us . When he saw them , Paul thanked God and took courage .
44028016	When we entered Rome , Paul was allowed to live by himself , with the soldier who was guarding him .
44028017	After three days Paul called the local Jewish leaders together . When they had assembled , he said to them , “ Brothers , although I had done nothing against our people or the customs of our ancestors , from Jerusalem I was handed over as a prisoner to the Romans .
44028018	When they had heard my case , they wanted to release me , because there was no basis for a death sentence against me .
44028019	But when the Jews objected , I was forced to appeal to Caesar – not that I had some charge to bring against my own people .
44028020	So for this reason I have asked to see you and speak with you , for I am bound with this chain because of the hope of Israel . ”
44028021	They replied , “ We have received no letters from Judea about you , nor have any of the brothers come from there and reported or said anything bad about you .
44028022	But we would like to hear from you what you think , for regarding this sect we know that people everywhere speak against it . ”
44028023	They set a day to meet with him , and they came to him where he was staying in even greater numbers . From morning until evening he explained things to them , testifying about the kingdom of God and trying to convince them about Jesus from both the law of Moses and the prophets .
44028024	Some were convinced by what he said , but others refused to believe .
44028025	So they began to leave , unable to agree among themselves , after Paul made one last statement : “ The Holy Spirit spoke rightly to your ancestors through the prophet Isaiah
44028026	when he said , ‘ Go to this people and say , “ You will keep on hearing , but will never understand , and you will keep on looking , but will never perceive .
44028027	For the heart of this people has become dull , and their ears are hard of hearing , and they have closed their eyes , so that they would not see with their eyes and hear with their ears and understand with their heart and turn , and I would heal them . ” ’
44028028	“ Therefore be advised that this salvation from God has been sent to the Gentiles ; they will listen ! ”
44028030	Paul lived there two whole years in his own rented quarters and welcomed all who came to him ,
44028031	proclaiming the kingdom of God and teaching about the Lord Jesus Christ with complete boldness and without restriction .
45001001	From Paul , a slave of Christ Jesus , called to be an apostle , set apart for the gospel of God .
45001002	This gospel he promised beforehand through his prophets in the holy scriptures ,
45001003	concerning his Son who was a descendant of David with reference to the flesh ,
45001004	who was appointed the Son-of-God-in-power according to the Holy Spirit by the resurrection from the dead , Jesus Christ our Lord .
45001005	Through him we have received grace and our apostleship to bring about the obedience of faith among all the Gentiles on behalf of his name .
45001006	You also are among them , called to belong to Jesus Christ .
45001007	To all those loved by God in Rome , called to be saints : Grace and peace to you from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ !
45001008	First of all , I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you , because your faith is proclaimed throughout the whole world .
45001009	For God , whom I serve in my spirit by preaching the gospel of his Son , is my witness that I continually remember you
45001010	and I always ask in my prayers , if perhaps now at last I may succeed in visiting you according to the will of God .
45001011	For I long to see you , so that I may impart to you some spiritual gift to strengthen you ,
45001012	that is , that we may be mutually comforted by one another’s faith , both yours and mine .
45001013	I do not want you to be unaware , brothers and sisters , that I often intended to come to you ( and was prevented until now ) , so that I may have some fruit even among you , just as I already have among the rest of the Gentiles .
45001014	I am a debtor both to the Greeks and to the barbarians , both to the wise and to the foolish .
45001015	Thus I am eager also to preach the gospel to you who are in Rome .
45001016	For I am not ashamed of the gospel , for it is God’s power for salvation to everyone who believes , to the Jew first and also to the Greek .
45001017	For the righteousness of God is revealed in the gospel from faith to faith , just as it is written , “ The righteous by faith will live . ”
45001018	For the wrath of God is revealed from heaven against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of people who suppress the truth by their unrighteousness ,
45001019	because what can be known about God is plain to them , because God has made it plain to them .
45001020	For since the creation of the world his invisible attributes – his eternal power and divine nature – have been clearly seen , because they are understood through what has been made . So people are without excuse .
45001021	For although they knew God , they did not glorify him as God or give him thanks , but they became futile in their thoughts and their senseless hearts were darkened .
45001022	Although they claimed to be wise , they became fools
45001023	and exchanged the glory of the immortal God for an image resembling mortal human beings or birds or four-footed animals or reptiles .
45001024	Therefore God gave them over in the desires of their hearts to impurity , to dishonor their bodies among themselves .
45001025	They exchanged the truth of God for a lie and worshiped and served the creation rather than the Creator , who is blessed forever ! Amen .
45001026	For this reason God gave them over to dishonorable passions . For their women exchanged the natural sexual relations for unnatural ones ,
45001027	and likewise the men also abandoned natural relations with women and were inflamed in their passions for one another . Men committed shameless acts with men and received in themselves the due penalty for their error .
45001028	And just as they did not see fit to acknowledge God , God gave them over to a depraved mind , to do what should not be done .
45001029	They are filled with every kind of unrighteousness , wickedness , covetousness , malice . They are rife with envy , murder , strife , deceit , hostility . They are gossips ,
45001030	slanderers , haters of God , insolent , arrogant , boastful , contrivers of all sorts of evil , disobedient to parents ,
45001031	senseless , covenant-breakers , heartless , ruthless .
45001032	Although they fully know God’s righteous decree that those who practice such things deserve to die , they not only do them but also approve of those who practice them .
45002001	Therefore you are without excuse , whoever you are , when you judge someone else . For on whatever grounds you judge another , you condemn yourself , because you who judge practice the same things .
45002002	Now we know that God’s judgment is in accordance with truth against those who practice such things .
45002003	And do you think , whoever you are , when you judge those who practice such things and yet do them yourself , that you will escape God’s judgment ?
45002004	Or do you have contempt for the wealth of his kindness , forbearance , and patience , and yet do not know that God’s kindness leads you to repentance ?
45002005	But because of your stubbornness and your unrepentant heart , you are storing up wrath for yourselves in the day of wrath , when God’s righteous judgment is revealed !
45002006	He will reward each one according to his works :
45002007	eternal life to those who by perseverance in good works seek glory and honor and immortality ,
45002008	but wrath and anger to those who live in selfish ambition and do not obey the truth but follow unrighteousness .
45002009	There will be affliction and distress on everyone who does evil , on the Jew first and also the Greek ,
45002010	but glory and honor and peace for everyone who does good , for the Jew first and also the Greek .
45002011	For there is no partiality with God .
45002012	For all who have sinned apart from the law will also perish apart from the law , and all who have sinned under the law will be judged by the law .
45002013	For it is not those who hear the law who are righteous before God , but those who do the law will be declared righteous .
45002014	For whenever the Gentiles , who do not have the law , do by nature the things required by the law , these who do not have the law are a law to themselves .
45002015	They show that the work of the law is written in their hearts , as their conscience bears witness and their conflicting thoughts accuse or else defend them ,
45002016	on the day when God will judge the secrets of human hearts , according to my gospel through Christ Jesus .
45002017	But if you call yourself a Jew and rely on the law and boast of your relationship to God
45002018	and know his will and approve the superior things because you receive instruction from the law ,
45002019	and if you are convinced that you yourself are a guide to the blind , a light to those who are in darkness ,
45002020	an educator of the senseless , a teacher of little children , because you have in the law the essential features of knowledge and of the truth –
45002021	therefore you who teach someone else , do you not teach yourself ? You who preach against stealing , do you steal ?
45002022	You who tell others not to commit adultery , do you commit adultery ? You who abhor idols , do you rob temples ?
45002023	You who boast in the law dishonor God by transgressing the law !
45002024	For just as it is written , “ the name of God is being blasphemed among the Gentiles because of you . ”
45002025	For circumcision has its value if you practice the law , but if you break the law , your circumcision has become uncircumcision .
45002026	Therefore if the uncircumcised man obeys the righteous requirements of the law , will not his uncircumcision be regarded as circumcision ?
45002027	And will not the physically uncircumcised man who keeps the law judge you who , despite the written code and circumcision , transgress the law ?
45002028	For a person is not a Jew who is one outwardly , nor is circumcision something that is outward in the flesh ,
45002029	but someone is a Jew who is one inwardly , and circumcision is of the heart by the Spirit and not by the written code . This person’s praise is not from people but from God .
45003001	Therefore what advantage does the Jew have , or what is the value of circumcision ?
45003002	Actually , there are many advantages . First of all , the Jews were entrusted with the oracles of God .
45003003	What then ? If some did not believe , does their unbelief nullify the faithfulness of God ?
45003004	Absolutely not ! Let God be proven true , and every human being shown up as a liar , just as it is written : “ so that you will be justified in your words and will prevail when you are judged . ”
45003005	But if our unrighteousness demonstrates the righteousness of God , what shall we say ? The God who inflicts wrath is not unrighteous , is he ? ( I am speaking in human terms . )
45003006	Absolutely not ! For otherwise how could God judge the world ?
45003007	For if by my lie the truth of God enhances his glory , why am I still actually being judged as a sinner ?
45003008	And why not say , “ Let us do evil so that good may come of it ” ? – as some who slander us allege that we say . ( Their condemnation is deserved ! )
45003009	What then ? Are we better off ? Certainly not , for we have already charged that Jews and Greeks alike are all under sin ,
45003010	just as it is written : “ There is no one righteous , not even one ,
45003011	there is no one who understands , there is no one who seeks God .
45003012	All have turned away , together they have become worthless ; there is no one who shows kindness , not even one . ”
45003013	“ Their throats are open graves , they deceive with their tongues , the poison of asps is under their lips . ”
45003014	“ Their mouths are full of cursing and bitterness . ”
45003015	“ Their feet are swift to shed blood ,
45003016	ruin and misery are in their paths ,
45003017	and the way of peace they have not known . ”
45003018	“ There is no fear of God before their eyes . ”
45003019	Now we know that whatever the law says , it says to those who are under the law , so that every mouth may be silenced and the whole world may be held accountable to God .
45003020	For no one is declared righteous before him by the works of the law , for through the law comes the knowledge of sin .
45003021	But now apart from the law the righteousness of God ( which is attested by the law and the prophets ) has been disclosed –
45003022	namely , the righteousness of God through the faithfulness of Jesus Christ for all who believe . For there is no distinction ,
45003023	for all have sinned and fall short of the glory of God .
45003024	But they are justified freely by his grace through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus .
45003025	God publicly displayed him at his death as the mercy seat accessible through faith . This was to demonstrate his righteousness , because God in his forbearance had passed over the sins previously committed .
45003026	This was also to demonstrate his righteousness in the present time , so that he would be just and the justifier of the one who lives because of Jesus’ faithfulness .
45003027	Where , then , is boasting ? It is excluded ! By what principle ? Of works ? No , but by the principle of faith !
45003028	For we consider that a person is declared righteous by faith apart from the works of the law .
45003029	Or is God the God of the Jews only ? Is he not the God of the Gentiles too ? Yes , of the Gentiles too !
45003030	Since God is one , he will justify the circumcised by faith and the uncircumcised through faith .
45003031	Do we then nullify the law through faith ? Absolutely not ! Instead we uphold the law .
45004001	What then shall we say that Abraham , our ancestor according to the flesh , has discovered regarding this matter ?
45004002	For if Abraham was declared righteous by the works of the law , he has something to boast about – but not before God .
45004003	For what does the scripture say ? “ Abraham believed God , and it was credited to him as righteousness . ”
45004004	Now to the one who works , his pay is not credited due to grace but due to obligation .
45004005	But to the one who does not work , but believes in the one who declares the ungodly righteous , his faith is credited as righteousness .
45004006	So even David himself speaks regarding the blessedness of the man to whom God credits righteousness apart from works :
45004007	“ Blessed are those whose lawless deeds are forgiven , and whose sins are covered ;
45004008	blessed is the one against whom the Lord will never count sin . ”
45004009	Is this blessedness then for the circumcision or also for the uncircumcision ? For we say , “ faith was credited to Abraham as righteousness . ”
45004010	How then was it credited to him ? Was he circumcised at the time , or not ? No , he was not circumcised but uncircumcised !
45004011	And he received the sign of circumcision as a seal of the righteousness that he had by faith while he was still uncircumcised , so that he would become the father of all those who believe but have never been circumcised , that they too could have righteousness credited to them .
45004012	And he is also the father of the circumcised , who are not only circumcised , but who also walk in the footsteps of the faith that our father Abraham possessed when he was still uncircumcised .
45004013	For the promise to Abraham or to his descendants that he would inherit the world was not fulfilled through the law , but through the righteousness that comes by faith .
45004014	For if they become heirs by the law , faith is empty and the promise is nullified .
45004015	For the law brings wrath , because where there is no law there is no transgression either .
45004016	For this reason it is by faith so that it may be by grace , with the result that the promise may be certain to all the descendants – not only to those who are under the law , but also to those who have the faith of Abraham , who is the father of us all
45004017	( as it is written , “ I have made you the father of many nations ” ) . He is our father in the presence of God whom he believed – the God who makes the dead alive and summons the things that do not yet exist as though they already do .
45004018	Against hope Abraham believed in hope with the result that he became the father of many nations according to the pronouncement , “ so will your descendants be . ”
45004019	Without being weak in faith , he considered his own body as dead ( because he was about one hundred years old ) and the deadness of Sarah’s womb .
45004020	He did not waver in unbelief about the promise of God but was strengthened in faith , giving glory to God .
45004021	He was fully convinced that what God promised he was also able to do .
45004022	So indeed it was credited to Abraham as righteousness .
45004023	But the statement it was credited to him was not written only for Abraham’s sake ,
45004024	but also for our sake , to whom it will be credited , those who believe in the one who raised Jesus our Lord from the dead .
45004025	He was given over because of our transgressions and was raised for the sake of our justification .
45005001	Therefore , since we have been declared righteous by faith , we have peace with God through our Lord Jesus Christ ,
45005002	through whom we have also obtained access by faith into this grace in which we stand , and we rejoice in the hope of God’s glory .
45005003	Not only this , but we also rejoice in sufferings , knowing that suffering produces endurance ,
45005004	and endurance , character , and character , hope .
45005005	And hope does not disappoint , because the love of God has been poured out in our hearts through the Holy Spirit who was given to us .
45005006	For while we were still helpless , at the right time Christ died for the ungodly .
45005007	( For rarely will anyone die for a righteous person , though for a good person perhaps someone might possibly dare to die . )
45005008	But God demonstrates his own love for us , in that while we were still sinners , Christ died for us .
45005009	Much more then , because we have now been declared righteous by his blood , we will be saved through him from God’s wrath .
45005010	For if while we were enemies we were reconciled to God through the death of his Son , how much more , since we have been reconciled , will we be saved by his life ?
45005011	Not only this , but we also rejoice in God through our Lord Jesus Christ , through whom we have now received this reconciliation .
45005012	So then , just as sin entered the world through one man and death through sin , and so death spread to all people because all sinned –
45005013	for before the law was given , sin was in the world , but there is no accounting for sin when there is no law .
45005014	Yet death reigned from Adam until Moses even over those who did not sin in the same way that Adam ( who is a type of the coming one ) transgressed .
45005015	But the gracious gift is not like the transgression . For if the many died through the transgression of the one man , how much more did the grace of God and the gift by the grace of the one man Jesus Christ multiply to the many !
45005016	And the gift is not like the one who sinned . For judgment , resulting from the one transgression , led to condemnation , but the gracious gift from the many failures led to justification .
45005017	For if , by the transgression of the one man , death reigned through the one , how much more will those who receive the abundance of grace and of the gift of righteousness reign in life through the one , Jesus Christ !
45005018	Consequently , just as condemnation for all people came through one transgression , so too through the one righteous act came righteousness leading to life for all people .
45005019	For just as through the disobedience of the one man many were made sinners , so also through the obedience of one man many will be made righteous .
45005020	Now the law came in so that the transgression may increase , but where sin increased , grace multiplied all the more ,
45005021	so that just as sin reigned in death , so also grace will reign through righteousness to eternal life through Jesus Christ our Lord .
45006001	What shall we say then ? Are we to remain in sin so that grace may increase ?
45006002	Absolutely not ! How can we who died to sin still live in it ?
45006003	Or do you not know that as many as were baptized into Christ Jesus were baptized into his death ?
45006004	Therefore we have been buried with him through baptism into death , in order that just as Christ was raised from the dead through the glory of the Father , so we too may live a new life .
45006005	For if we have become united with him in the likeness of his death , we will certainly also be united in the likeness of his resurrection .
45006006	We know that our old man was crucified with him so that the body of sin would no longer dominate us , so that we would no longer be enslaved to sin .
45006007	( For someone who has died has been freed from sin . )
45006008	Now if we died with Christ , we believe that we will also live with him .
45006009	We know that since Christ has been raised from the dead , he is never going to die again ; death no longer has mastery over him .
45006010	For the death he died , he died to sin once for all , but the life he lives , he lives to God .
45006011	So you too consider yourselves dead to sin , but alive to God in Christ Jesus .
45006012	Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body so that you obey its desires ,
45006013	and do not present your members to sin as instruments to be used for unrighteousness , but present yourselves to God as those who are alive from the dead and your members to God as instruments to be used for righteousness .
45006014	For sin will have no mastery over you , because you are not under law but under grace .
45006015	What then ? Shall we sin because we are not under law but under grace ? Absolutely not !
45006016	Do you not know that if you present yourselves as obedient slaves , you are slaves of the one you obey , either of sin resulting in death , or obedience resulting in righteousness ?
45006017	But thanks be to God that though you were slaves to sin , you obeyed from the heart that pattern of teaching you were entrusted to ,
45006018	and having been freed from sin , you became enslaved to righteousness .
45006019	( I am speaking in human terms because of the weakness of your flesh . ) For just as you once presented your members as slaves to impurity and lawlessness leading to more lawlessness , so now present your members as slaves to righteousness leading to sanctification .
45006020	For when you were slaves of sin , you were free with regard to righteousness .
45006021	So what benefit did you then reap from those things that you are now ashamed of ? For the end of those things is death .
45006022	But now , freed from sin and enslaved to God , you have your benefit leading to sanctification , and the end is eternal life .
45006023	For the payoff of sin is death , but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45007001	Or do you not know , brothers and sisters ( for I am speaking to those who know the law ) , that the law is lord over a person as long as he lives ?
45007002	For a married woman is bound by law to her husband as long as he lives , but if her husband dies , she is released from the law of the marriage .
45007003	So then , if she is joined to another man while her husband is alive , she will be called an adulteress . But if her husband dies , she is free from that law , and if she is joined to another man , she is not an adulteress .
45007004	So , my brothers and sisters , you also died to the law through the body of Christ , so that you could be joined to another , to the one who was raised from the dead , to bear fruit to God .
45007005	For when we were in the flesh , the sinful desires , aroused by the law , were active in the members of our body to bear fruit for death .
45007006	But now we have been released from the law , because we have died to what controlled us , so that we may serve in the new life of the Spirit and not under the old written code .
45007007	What shall we say then ? Is the law sin ? Absolutely not ! Certainly , I would not have known sin except through the law . For indeed I would not have known what it means to desire something belonging to someone else if the law had not said , “ Do not covet . ”
45007008	But sin , seizing the opportunity through the commandment , produced in me all kinds of wrong desires . For apart from the law , sin is dead .
45007009	And I was once alive apart from the law , but with the coming of the commandment sin became alive
45007010	and I died . So I found that the very commandment that was intended to bring life brought death !
45007011	For sin , seizing the opportunity through the commandment , deceived me and through it I died .
45007012	So then , the law is holy , and the commandment is holy , righteous , and good .
45007013	Did that which is good , then , become death to me ? Absolutely not ! But sin , so that it would be shown to be sin , produced death in me through what is good , so that through the commandment sin would become utterly sinful .
45007014	For we know that the law is spiritual – but I am unspiritual , sold into slavery to sin .
45007015	For I don’t understand what I am doing . For I do not do what I want – instead , I do what I hate .
45007016	But if I do what I don’t want , I agree that the law is good .
45007017	But now it is no longer me doing it , but sin that lives in me .
45007018	For I know that nothing good lives in me , that is , in my flesh . For I want to do the good , but I cannot do it .
45007019	For I do not do the good I want , but I do the very evil I do not want !
45007020	Now if I do what I do not want , it is no longer me doing it but sin that lives in me .
45007021	So , I find the law that when I want to do good , evil is present with me .
45007022	For I delight in the law of God in my inner being .
45007023	But I see a different law in my members waging war against the law of my mind and making me captive to the law of sin that is in my members .
45007024	Wretched man that I am ! Who will rescue me from this body of death ?
45007025	Thanks be to God through Jesus Christ our Lord ! So then , I myself serve the law of God with my mind , but with my flesh I serve the law of sin .
45008001	There is therefore now no condemnation for those who are in Christ Jesus .
45008002	For the law of the life-giving Spirit in Christ Jesus has set you free from the law of sin and death .
45008003	For God achieved what the law could not do because it was weakened through the flesh . By sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh and concerning sin , he condemned sin in the flesh ,
45008004	so that the righteous requirement of the law may be fulfilled in us , who do not walk according to the flesh but according to the Spirit .
45008005	For those who live according to the flesh have their outlook shaped by the things of the flesh , but those who live according to the Spirit have their outlook shaped by the things of the Spirit .
45008006	For the outlook of the flesh is death , but the outlook of the Spirit is life and peace ,
45008007	because the outlook of the flesh is hostile to God , for it does not submit to the law of God , nor is it able to do so .
45008008	Those who are in the flesh cannot please God .
45008009	You , however , are not in the flesh but in the Spirit , if indeed the Spirit of God lives in you . Now if anyone does not have the Spirit of Christ , this person does not belong to him .
45008010	But if Christ is in you , your body is dead because of sin , but the Spirit is your life because of righteousness .
45008011	Moreover if the Spirit of the one who raised Jesus from the dead lives in you , the one who raised Christ from the dead will also make your mortal bodies alive through his Spirit who lives in you .
45008012	So then , brothers and sisters , we are under obligation , not to the flesh , to live according to the flesh
45008013	( for if you live according to the flesh , you will die ) , but if by the Spirit you put to death the deeds of the body you will live .
45008014	For all who are led by the Spirit of God are the sons of God .
45008015	For you did not receive the spirit of slavery leading again to fear , but you received the Spirit of adoption , by whom we cry , “ Abba , Father . ”
45008016	The Spirit himself bears witness to our spirit that we are God’s children .
45008017	And if children , then heirs ( namely , heirs of God and also fellow heirs with Christ ) – if indeed we suffer with him so we may also be glorified with him .
45008018	For I consider that our present sufferings cannot even be compared to the glory that will be revealed to us .
45008019	For the creation eagerly waits for the revelation of the sons of God .
45008020	For the creation was subjected to futility – not willingly but because of God who subjected it – in hope
45008021	that the creation itself will also be set free from the bondage of decay into the glorious freedom of God’s children .
45008022	For we know that the whole creation groans and suffers together until now .
45008023	Not only this , but we ourselves also , who have the firstfruits of the Spirit , groan inwardly as we eagerly await our adoption , the redemption of our bodies .
45008024	For in hope we were saved . Now hope that is seen is not hope , because who hopes for what he sees ?
45008025	But if we hope for what we do not see , we eagerly wait for it with endurance .
45008026	In the same way , the Spirit helps us in our weakness , for we do not know how we should pray , but the Spirit himself intercedes for us with inexpressible groanings .
45008027	And he who searches our hearts knows the mind of the Spirit , because the Spirit intercedes on behalf of the saints according to God’s will .
45008028	And we know that all things work together for good for those who love God , who are called according to his purpose ,
45008029	because those whom he foreknew he also predestined to be conformed to the image of his Son , that his Son would be the firstborn among many brothers and sisters .
45008030	And those he predestined , he also called ; and those he called , he also justified ; and those he justified , he also glorified .
45008031	What then shall we say about these things ? If God is for us , who can be against us ?
45008032	Indeed , he who did not spare his own Son , but gave him up for us all – how will he not also , along with him , freely give us all things ?
45008033	Who will bring any charge against God’s elect ? It is God who justifies .
45008034	Who is the one who will condemn ? Christ is the one who died ( and more than that , he was raised ) , who is at the right hand of God , and who also is interceding for us .
45008035	Who will separate us from the love of Christ ? Will trouble , or distress , or persecution , or famine , or nakedness , or danger , or sword ?
45008036	As it is written , “ For your sake we encounter death all day long ; we were considered as sheep to be slaughtered . ”
45008037	No , in all these things we have complete victory through him who loved us !
45008038	For I am convinced that neither death , nor life , nor angels , nor heavenly rulers , nor things that are present , nor things to come , nor powers ,
45008039	nor height , nor depth , nor anything else in creation will be able to separate us from the love of God in Christ Jesus our Lord .
45009001	I am telling the truth in Christ ( I am not lying ! ) , for my conscience assures me in the Holy Spirit –
45009002	I have great sorrow and unceasing anguish in my heart .
45009003	For I could wish that I myself were accursed – cut off from Christ – for the sake of my people , my fellow countrymen ,
45009004	who are Israelites . To them belong the adoption as sons , the glory , the covenants , the giving of the law , the temple worship , and the promises .
45009005	To them belong the patriarchs , and from them , by human descent , came the Christ , who is God over all , blessed forever ! Amen .
45009006	It is not as though the word of God had failed . For not all those who are descended from Israel are truly Israel ,
45009007	nor are all the children Abraham’s true descendants ; rather “ through Isaac will your descendants be counted . ”
45009008	This means it is not the children of the flesh who are the children of God ; rather , the children of promise are counted as descendants .
45009009	For this is what the promise declared : “ About a year from now I will return and Sarah will have a son . ”
45009010	Not only that , but when Rebekah had conceived children by one man , our ancestor Isaac –
45009011	even before they were born or had done anything good or bad ( so that God’s purpose in election would stand , not by works but by his calling ) –
45009012	it was said to her , “ The older will serve the younger , ”
45009013	just as it is written : “ Jacob I loved , but Esau I hated . ”
45009014	What shall we say then ? Is there injustice with God ? Absolutely not !
45009015	For he says to Moses : “ I will have mercy on whom I have mercy , and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion . ”
45009016	So then , it does not depend on human desire or exertion , but on God who shows mercy .
45009017	For the scripture says to Pharaoh : “ For this very purpose I have raised you up , that I may demonstrate my power in you , and that my name may be proclaimed in all the earth . ”
45009018	So then , God has mercy on whom he chooses to have mercy , and he hardens whom he chooses to harden .
45009019	You will say to me then , “ Why does he still find fault ? For who has ever resisted his will ? ”
45009020	But who indeed are you – a mere human being – to talk back to God ? Does what is molded say to the molder , “ Why have you made me like this ? ”
45009021	Has the potter no right to make from the same lump of clay one vessel for special use and another for ordinary use ?
45009022	But what if God , willing to demonstrate his wrath and to make known his power , has endured with much patience the objects of wrath prepared for destruction ?
45009023	And what if he is willing to make known the wealth of his glory on the objects of mercy that he has prepared beforehand for glory –
45009024	even us , whom he has called , not only from the Jews but also from the Gentiles ?
45009025	As he also says in Hosea : “ I will call those who were not my people , ‘ My people , ’ and I will call her who was unloved , ‘ My beloved . ’ ”
45009026	“ And in the very place where it was said to them , ‘ You are not my people , ’ there they will be called ‘ sons of the living God . ’ ”
45009027	And Isaiah cries out on behalf of Israel , “ Though the number of the children of Israel are as the sand of the sea , only the remnant will be saved ,
45009028	for the Lord will execute his sentence on the earth completely and quickly . ”
45009029	Just as Isaiah predicted , “ If the Lord of armies had not left us descendants , we would have become like Sodom , and we would have resembled Gomorrah . ”
45009030	What shall we say then ? – that the Gentiles who did not pursue righteousness obtained it , that is , a righteousness that is by faith ,
45009031	but Israel even though pursuing a law of righteousness did not attain it .
45009032	Why not ? Because they pursued it not by faith but ( as if it were possible ) by works . They stumbled over the stumbling stone ,
45009033	just as it is written , “ Look , I am laying in Zion a stone that will cause people to stumble and a rock that will make them fall , yet the one who believes in him will not be put to shame . ”
45010001	Brothers and sisters , my heart’s desire and prayer to God on behalf of my fellow Israelites is for their salvation .
45010002	For I can testify that they are zealous for God , but their zeal is not in line with the truth .
45010003	For ignoring the righteousness that comes from God , and seeking instead to establish their own righteousness , they did not submit to God’s righteousness .
45010004	For Christ is the end of the law , with the result that there is righteousness for everyone who believes .
45010005	For Moses writes about the righteousness that is by the law : “ The one who does these things will live by them . ”
45010006	But the righteousness that is by faith says : “ Do not say in your heart , ‘ Who will ascend into heaven ? ’ ” ( that is , to bring Christ down )
45010007	or “ Who will descend into the abyss ? ” ( that is , to bring Christ up from the dead ) .
45010008	But what does it say ? “ The word is near you , in your mouth and in your heart ” ( that is , the word of faith that we preach ) ,
45010009	because if you confess with your mouth that Jesus is Lord and believe in your heart that God raised him from the dead , you will be saved .
45010010	For with the heart one believes and thus has righteousness and with the mouth one confesses and thus has salvation .
45010011	For the scripture says , “ Everyone who believes in him will not be put to shame . ”
45010012	For there is no distinction between the Jew and the Greek , for the same Lord is Lord of all , who richly blesses all who call on him .
45010013	For everyone who calls on the name of the Lord will be saved .
45010014	How are they to call on one they have not believed in ? And how are they to believe in one they have not heard of ? And how are they to hear without someone preaching to them ?
45010015	And how are they to preach unless they are sent ? As it is written , “ How timely is the arrival of those who proclaim the good news . ”
45010016	But not all have obeyed the good news , for Isaiah says , “ Lord , who has believed our report ? ”
45010017	Consequently faith comes from what is heard , and what is heard comes through the preached word of Christ .
45010018	But I ask , have they not heard ? Yes , they have : Their voice has gone out to all the earth , and their words to the ends of the world .
45010019	But again I ask , didn’t Israel understand ? First Moses says , “ I will make you jealous by those who are not a nation ; with a senseless nation I will provoke you to anger . ”
45010020	And Isaiah is even bold enough to say , “ I was found by those who did not seek me ; I became well known to those who did not ask for me . ”
45010021	But about Israel he says , “ All day long I held out my hands to this disobedient and stubborn people ! ”
45011001	So I ask , God has not rejected his people , has he ? Absolutely not ! For I too am an Israelite , a descendant of Abraham , from the tribe of Benjamin .
45011002	God has not rejected his people whom he foreknew ! Do you not know what the scripture says about Elijah , how he pleads with God against Israel ?
45011003	“ Lord , they have killed your prophets , they have demolished your altars ; I alone am left and they are seeking my life ! ”
45011004	But what was the divine response to him ? “ I have kept for myself seven thousand people who have not bent the knee to Baal . ”
45011005	So in the same way at the present time there is a remnant chosen by grace .
45011006	And if it is by grace , it is no longer by works , otherwise grace would no longer be grace .
45011007	What then ? Israel failed to obtain what it was diligently seeking , but the elect obtained it . The rest were hardened ,
45011008	as it is written , “ God gave them a spirit of stupor , eyes that would not see and ears that would not hear , to this very day . ”
45011009	And David says , “ Let their table become a snare and trap , a stumbling block and a retribution for them ;
45011010	let their eyes be darkened so that they may not see , and make their backs bend continually . ”
45011011	I ask then , they did not stumble into an irrevocable fall , did they ? Absolutely not ! But by their transgression salvation has come to the Gentiles , to make Israel jealous .
45011012	Now if their transgression means riches for the world and their defeat means riches for the Gentiles , how much more will their full restoration bring ?
45011013	Now I am speaking to you Gentiles . Seeing that I am an apostle to the Gentiles , I magnify my ministry ,
45011014	if somehow I could provoke my people to jealousy and save some of them .
45011015	For if their rejection is the reconciliation of the world , what will their acceptance be but life from the dead ?
45011016	If the first portion of the dough offered is holy , then the whole batch is holy , and if the root is holy , so too are the branches .
45011017	Now if some of the branches were broken off , and you , a wild olive shoot , were grafted in among them and participated in the richness of the olive root ,
45011018	do not boast over the branches . But if you boast , remember that you do not support the root , but the root supports you .
45011019	Then you will say , “ The branches were broken off so that I could be grafted in . ”
45011020	Granted ! They were broken off because of their unbelief , but you stand by faith . Do not be arrogant , but fear !
45011021	For if God did not spare the natural branches , perhaps he will not spare you .
45011022	Notice therefore the kindness and harshness of God – harshness toward those who have fallen , but God’s kindness toward you , provided you continue in his kindness ; otherwise you also will be cut off .
45011023	And even they – if they do not continue in their unbelief – will be grafted in , for God is able to graft them in again .
45011024	For if you were cut off from what is by nature a wild olive tree , and grafted , contrary to nature , into a cultivated olive tree , how much more will these natural branches be grafted back into their own olive tree ?
45011025	For I do not want you to be ignorant of this mystery , brothers and sisters , so that you may not be conceited : A partial hardening has happened to Israel until the full number of the Gentiles has come in .
45011026	And so all Israel will be saved , as it is written : “ The Deliverer will come out of Zion ; he will remove ungodliness from Jacob .
45011027	And this is my covenant with them , when I take away their sins . ”
45011028	In regard to the gospel they are enemies for your sake , but in regard to election they are dearly loved for the sake of the fathers .
45011029	For the gifts and the call of God are irrevocable .
45011030	Just as you were formerly disobedient to God , but have now received mercy due to their disobedience ,
45011031	so they too have now been disobedient in order that , by the mercy shown to you , they too may now receive mercy .
45011032	For God has consigned all people to disobedience so that he may show mercy to them all .
45011033	Oh , the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God ! How unsearchable are his judgments and how fathomless his ways !
45011034	For who has known the mind of the Lord , or who has been his counselor ?
45011035	Or who has first given to God , that God needs to repay him ?
45011036	For from him and through him and to him are all things . To him be glory forever ! Amen .
45012001	Therefore I exhort you , brothers and sisters , by the mercies of God , to present your bodies as a sacrifice – alive , holy , and pleasing to God – which is your reasonable service .
45012002	Do not be conformed to this present world , but be transformed by the renewing of your mind , so that you may test and approve what is the will of God – what is good and well-pleasing and perfect .
45012003	For by the grace given to me I say to every one of you not to think more highly of yourself than you ought to think , but to think with sober discernment , as God has distributed to each of you a measure of faith .
45012004	For just as in one body we have many members , and not all the members serve the same function ,
45012005	so we who are many are one body in Christ , and individually we are members who belong to one another .
45012006	And we have different gifts according to the grace given to us . If the gift is prophecy , that individual must use it in proportion to his faith .
45012007	If it is service , he must serve ; if it is teaching , he must teach ;
45012008	if it is exhortation , he must exhort ; if it is contributing , he must do so with sincerity ; if it is leadership , he must do so with diligence ; if it is showing mercy , he must do so with cheerfulness .
45012009	Love must be without hypocrisy . Abhor what is evil , cling to what is good .
45012010	Be devoted to one another with mutual love , showing eagerness in honoring one another .
45012011	Do not lag in zeal , be enthusiastic in spirit , serve the Lord .
45012012	Rejoice in hope , endure in suffering , persist in prayer .
45012013	Contribute to the needs of the saints , pursue hospitality .
45012014	Bless those who persecute you , bless and do not curse .
45012015	Rejoice with those who rejoice , weep with those who weep .
45012016	Live in harmony with one another ; do not be haughty but associate with the lowly . Do not be conceited .
45012017	Do not repay anyone evil for evil ; consider what is good before all people .
45012018	If possible , so far as it depends on you , live peaceably with all people .
45012019	Do not avenge yourselves , dear friends , but give place to God’s wrath , for it is written , “ Vengeance is mine , I will repay , ” says the Lord .
45012020	Rather , if your enemy is hungry , feed him ; if he is thirsty , give him a drink ; for in doing this you will be heaping burning coals on his head .
45012021	Do not be overcome by evil , but overcome evil with good .
45013001	Let every person be subject to the governing authorities . For there is no authority except by God’s appointment , and the authorities that exist have been instituted by God .
45013002	So the person who resists such authority resists the ordinance of God , and those who resist will incur judgment
45013003	( for rulers cause no fear for good conduct but for bad ) . Do you desire not to fear authority ? Do good and you will receive its commendation ,
45013004	for it is God’s servant for your good . But if you do wrong , be in fear , for it does not bear the sword in vain . It is God’s servant to administer retribution on the wrongdoer .
45013005	Therefore it is necessary to be in subjection , not only because of the wrath of the authorities but also because of your conscience .
45013006	For this reason you also pay taxes , for the authorities are God’s servants devoted to governing .
45013007	Pay everyone what is owed : taxes to whom taxes are due , revenue to whom revenue is due , respect to whom respect is due , honor to whom honor is due .
45013008	Owe no one anything , except to love one another , for the one who loves his neighbor has fulfilled the law .
45013009	For the commandments , “ Do not commit adultery , do not murder , do not steal , do not covet , ” ( and if there is any other commandment ) are summed up in this , “ Love your neighbor as yourself . ”
45013010	Love does no wrong to a neighbor . Therefore love is the fulfillment of the law .
45013011	And do this because we know the time , that it is already the hour for us to awake from sleep , for our salvation is now nearer than when we became believers .
45013012	The night has advanced toward dawn ; the day is near . So then we must lay aside the works of darkness , and put on the weapons of light .
45013013	Let us live decently as in the daytime , not in carousing and drunkenness , not in sexual immorality and sensuality , not in discord and jealousy .
45013014	Instead , put on the Lord Jesus Christ , and make no provision for the flesh to arouse its desires .
45014001	Now receive the one who is weak in the faith , and do not have disputes over differing opinions .
45014002	One person believes in eating everything , but the weak person eats only vegetables .
45014003	The one who eats everything must not despise the one who does not , and the one who abstains must not judge the one who eats everything , for God has accepted him .
45014004	Who are you to pass judgment on another’s servant ? Before his own master he stands or falls . And he will stand , for the Lord is able to make him stand .
45014005	One person regards one day holier than other days , and another regards them all alike . Each must be fully convinced in his own mind .
45014006	The one who observes the day does it for the Lord . The one who eats , eats for the Lord because he gives thanks to God , and the one who abstains from eating abstains for the Lord , and he gives thanks to God .
45014007	For none of us lives for himself and none dies for himself .
45014008	If we live , we live for the Lord ; if we die , we die for the Lord . Therefore , whether we live or die , we are the Lord’s .
45014009	For this reason Christ died and returned to life , so that he may be the Lord of both the dead and the living .
45014010	But you who eat vegetables only – why do you judge your brother or sister ? And you who eat everything – why do you despise your brother or sister ? For we will all stand before the judgment seat of God .
45014011	For it is written , “ As I live , says the Lord , every knee will bow to me , and every tongue will give praise to God . ”
45014012	Therefore , each of us will give an account of himself to God .
45014013	Therefore we must not pass judgment on one another , but rather determine never to place an obstacle or a trap before a brother or sister .
45014014	I know and am convinced in the Lord Jesus that there is nothing unclean in itself ; still , it is unclean to the one who considers it unclean .
45014015	For if your brother or sister is distressed because of what you eat , you are no longer walking in love . Do not destroy by your food someone for whom Christ died .
45014016	Therefore do not let what you consider good be spoken of as evil .
45014017	For the kingdom of God does not consist of food and drink , but righteousness , peace , and joy in the Holy Spirit .
45014018	For the one who serves Christ in this way is pleasing to God and approved by people .
45014019	So then , let us pursue what makes for peace and for building up one another .
45014020	Do not destroy the work of God for the sake of food . For although all things are clean , it is wrong to cause anyone to stumble by what you eat .
45014021	It is good not to eat meat or drink wine or to do anything that causes your brother to stumble .
45014022	The faith you have , keep to yourself before God . Blessed is the one who does not judge himself by what he approves .
45014023	But the man who doubts is condemned if he eats , because he does not do so from faith , and whatever is not from faith is sin .
45015001	But we who are strong ought to bear with the failings of the weak , and not just please ourselves .
45015002	Let each of us please his neighbor for his good to build him up .
45015003	For even Christ did not please himself , but just as it is written , “ The insults of those who insult you have fallen on me . ”
45015004	For everything that was written in former times was written for our instruction , so that through endurance and through encouragement of the scriptures we may have hope .
45015005	Now may the God of endurance and comfort give you unity with one another in accordance with Christ Jesus ,
45015006	so that together you may with one voice glorify the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ .
45015007	Receive one another , then , just as Christ also received you , to God’s glory .
45015008	For I tell you that Christ has become a servant of the circumcised on behalf of God’s truth to confirm the promises made to the fathers ,
45015009	and thus the Gentiles glorify God for his mercy . As it is written , “ Because of this I will confess you among the Gentiles , and I will sing praises to your name . ”
45015010	And again it says : “ Rejoice , O Gentiles , with his people . ”
45015011	And again , “ Praise the Lord all you Gentiles , and let all the peoples praise him . ”
45015012	And again Isaiah says , “ The root of Jesse will come , and the one who rises to rule over the Gentiles , in him will the Gentiles hope . ”
45015013	Now may the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace as you believe in him , so that you may abound in hope by the power of the Holy Spirit .
45015014	But I myself am fully convinced about you , my brothers and sisters , that you yourselves are full of goodness , filled with all knowledge , and able to instruct one another .
45015015	But I have written more boldly to you on some points so as to remind you , because of the grace given to me by God
45015016	to be a minister of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles . I serve the gospel of God like a priest , so that the Gentiles may become an acceptable offering , sanctified by the Holy Spirit .
45015017	So I boast in Christ Jesus about the things that pertain to God .
45015018	For I will not dare to speak of anything except what Christ has accomplished through me in order to bring about the obedience of the Gentiles , by word and deed ,
45015019	in the power of signs and wonders , in the power of the Spirit of God . So from Jerusalem even as far as Illyricum I have fully preached the gospel of Christ .
45015020	And in this way I desire to preach where Christ has not been named , so as not to build on another person’s foundation ,
